reviews.review: Great site beware of false guides outside. Wonderful site to see. This building used to be an islamic school. The architecture was fantastic. Beware of false guides outside. They will lie about who they are and say they do not want money. They are lying. Go in and pay the enterance fee, 10DH. There are official guides inside that can show you around for a tip.

Interesting historic student hall of residence!. The Medersa Ben Youssef was used for around four centuries as a place for students to stay, learn and worship. Though the rooms seem a bit stark now, it must have been a lovely place to live. The walls and ceilings are covered with intricate carvings, geometric tile-work, plaster stuccowork and murals - all really attractive to the eye. Definitely worth the 20DHM entrance fee for an hour's quiet wander around the corridors, rooms and hallways of this place.
Old Madrasa at the heart of the city. The madrasa is one of the best places in the Marrakech. It takes around 2 hours to visit and see madrasa.

Incredible plasterwork, but not top of the list. I mean its beautiful inside, and the plasterwork and ceilings are amazing, but pretty similar to other buildings in the medina. Suggest u give a miss if you are on a tight schedule.

Historic Koranic School. Very interesting history. We enjoyed wandering round the many corridors, rooms and balconies to get a taste of life for students many years ago. Beautiful tiling and woodwork. Amazing that this is in the middle of busy streets.

Worth a short visit. Like so many beautiful places or things in the Third World, this is not in the best state of repair, but the entry price is reasonable and the building itself worth 45-60 minutes of your time to admire the designs and decoration, as well as imagine life for its inhabitants in a very different age.

fantastic architecture history and atmosphere. It's on the tourist trail, so you are likely to be faced with many other people visiting in the main seasons, but it is well worth a visit if you are interested in Arabic architecture, decoration, art and history. Even the toilets are an attraction!

AMAZING. This is probably the best place to visit whilst you are in Marrakech. Fantastic architecture and a great place for photography. Don't quite understand why other reviewers won't blown away by this place, we absolutely loved it. Definitely worth a visit it.

Pleasant visit. This was our first sight to visit and glad enjoyed the architecture and detail. Happy we started off with this site because we found the other big sights more impressive. D10 entrance.

Great and well maintain building. The court yards are amazing tile work and ceilings,each room has different decorationIt is important to get a local guide to give you the proper explanation about what was the building use for
Interesting. Some amazing architecture, well worth a visit . Even though it was busy you were never caught up in big crowds

Fabulous example of a madersa. I've visited the madersa in Fes, which is often talked about as the best in Morocco, so wasn't sure what the Ben Youssef was going to be like. I wanted to take my boyfriend to visit it as unlike me he'd not been to Fes - and I was really pleased to find that this example was equally interesting to visit. It has all the expected features, with beautiful tiling, stucco and woodwork, and in addition visitors are able to roam about in the rooms which were the dormitories, which makes for a really interesting experience. Definitely worth the 20 Dirham entrance fee.

It's worth seeing didn't blow me away. My friend and I went to see this. It's not free to be ready to pay 20DRs each. Once inside it's quite an impressive building, it's she is quite something too.There isn't much in the explanation of what the building is, and what's there is in French and Arabic. Two languages I am not fluent in. I google the building though and read some articles and understood better.The tiles are impressive but the rest there is not much going on. Yes see it but don't hang around too long. Not much to see or do, it's an empty building.
Interesting. A great place to experience the architecture of Marrakech.Also a good chance to cool off when the weather gets warm.Worth a visit
the pattern. SUCH AMAZING PATTERNS. also of course cool that it was graves. magnifisent. great entry price (about 2 euros)

Worth a Quick Visit. Great for photography but this is a quick (less than 1 hour) visit as a lot of the Madrasa is not in good condition. Beware of dark stairwells going upstairs - it is easy to trip!

A slice of history. Although only a short visit, it is very interesting to visit the Ben Youssef Madrasa (Koranic school) in Marrakech. Easy to find, only a short walk from the Marrakech Museum, the Madrasa provides an insight into the lives of the young men who would have studied her over the years. The mainly windowless rooms remind you of the hardship of such commitment but the overall visit to the building is memorable.
Gorgeous mosaics and carvings.. A must see in Morocco which includes fascinating old photos of Marrakesh when Ben Youssef Madrasa was a school.

Absolutely stunning. An incredible example of Moroccan architecture with beautifully intricate detail. The carvings and mosaics are stunning! I didn't get a tour although many other visitors seemed to, but it was fine for me to walk around and take photos. Definitely recommended when in Marrakech.

Interesting - but go with a guide!. We visited without a guide and really regretted it as we didn't realise it wasn't a mosque! I realise that is our own ignorance but I really recommend taking a guide to understand the building and the scripture!

Beautiful, authentic, very nice architecture. Located in media of Marrakech, get a map, print out it or get the location on your phone as I sturgled a bit to find a place. And when you get there, avoid all the guys right at the door offering you to take you around the media or show you any directions, as at the beginning it will seems friendly and helpful but at the end you will have to pay them for showing the way and they do not accept coins, they want notes for their friendly service. Place itself is amazing, architecture is second to none... You can see how the students and their profesors used to live and study... Amazing place to take pictures!Definitely place to visit while in Marrakech
Impressive architecture!. A must see - beautiful verses of the Koran were etched into the plaster and the entire building had a regal feel. Very majestic!

Stunned by the exquisite artworks. The Medersa is definitely worth a visit. I was stunned by this exceptional artwork you'll find in the yard of the building. One of the greatest piece of architecture you'll find in Marrakech.
The inside of a Madrasa. You can visit the inside of this no longer used Madrasa and imagine how it would be when islamic students from everywhere used to come here.

Nice !!!!. the Madrasa visit was good , we enjoyed the tour , the architecture is so beautiful , very interesting place to visit while you are in Marrakesh .all explanation are in Arabic and French . recommended to hire a tour guide for other languages speakers.located close to Marrakech museum , and the ladder market .the fees are so affordable 2 euros per person .definitely worth a visit .

Good spot for a photo-op. The place has many spots for photos, however, it's normally packed with tourists so it's hard to get one without anyone in the background. Amazing architecture and designs! I wish they had posted something in English, explaining the history.

Probably best with a guide. Another marvel of Marrakech, this building is a must-see when visiting. Elaborate patterns and insane carvings and sculpting makes for great impressions when walking throughout. We decided to go in without a guide, and instantly regretted it, there are very few (we found 1) signs in english, and there are a lot of rooms who obviously have a great history, but are hard to interpret if you don't have inside knowledge.
buena cultura. medina of Marrakech. At the square you can find various merchants selling local goods. One can watch particularly well the bustle of medina right at the edge of the square.
beautiful a most see. more than i expected, getting there was and experience, our guide was also very knowledge as was most of the people we met
Amazing architecture and history. The student rooms are so tiny - worth a look to understand the conditions the students undertook in the name of education.

Highlight of the trip!. Probably my favorite touristy thing from the trip. 20dh to get in and we spent an hour or so wandering around the school and taking it in, but you probably wouldn't spend longer than that there. And it's not that hard to find, even wandering through the souks - just keep going in a general straight direction from Jemaa el Fna until you get to the edge! No need to hire a guide.
Holiday. Only 20 dirhans to get in so cheap but needs maintenance so they should increase the prices. You can appreciate the craftsmanship but needs more information on the history.
beautiful and a must visit attraction. This is a must see attraction in Marrakech and it's easy to see why. Beautiful tile work and so easy to take masses of photos
amazing !. It's the most impressive school I saw in my life. the work of art is amazing. Make sure to visit !!!
Historic Place. Worth a visit to learn something about an old way of student life, beautiful tiles etc. Not too crowded, however the usual Selfie poses, get in the way
Beautiful and visitors from every country!. This is one of those special places like the Colosseum in Rome. Beautiful and draws people from all cultures. Definitely worth fitting in your itinerary!

Stunning Moroccan architecture. Great place in the heart of the old Marrakech Medina.. The architechtural style, mosaics and colorful tiles makes this place a joy to watch..Being as old as it is.. every wall has a story
Beautiful Place!. Beautiful place that shows you the exquisite taste of Moroccan architecthure.A perfect spot for photography. Don't miss it!
Worth a visit. Beautiful architecture and worth a visit when in Marrakesh. The place is easily located in the center of the Medina so it will not be difficult to find it.
Must see. Dusty and ancient, but also beautiful, educational, and well worth the visit..ancient Islamic school, has been partially restored. An architectural gem.

Do go with a booked guide. This was our 2nd trip to Marrakech and we did not fit it in on our first trip so decided to go this time. Glad we did as it is beautiful but do go with a booked guide as there are no signs that we saw explaining the history or background and without our guide it would have just been a beautiful old building mid restoration.

Well worth a visit . Interesting place to visit with stunning architectural details. The main courtyard has cedar wood carvings and is overlooked by rows of dormitory windows. Wandering around the old corridors and rooms gives an atmospheric feel for what it might have been like to study here.

Wonderful building. This place is stunning. The architecture is incredible with the variety of tiles simply incredible. It looks good from every angle and you can only imagine what it may have been like to study here. Well worth a visit

Absolutely STUNNING!. Beautiful old Quranic school, gorgeous architecture with so much attention to detail that it blows the mind. Photos of the place just do not do it justice. And it's a very modest ticket price...I think when we visited in Sept it was only 20 Dirrham each..around £1.80 per person. Great artefacts from bygone ages also. Absolutely beautiful.

Medrassa as a center of Islamic knowledge.. Spectacular tiles work ...purely Moroccan.The rooms have small windows as part of architectural ideas of the desert. This institution is not working now. 500 years old. And the western poor translation of Medrassa as Koranic school is not right as during its best times it had large faculties of physical sciences.

Filled with 'guides' who beg and threaten people. Be cautious!. I visited this building and first impressions were good. It's 20dhs to go in - reasonable. The main courtyard is impressive. But that is where it ends. All other rooms are almost identical, empty, plain, dull, former bed rooms or classrooms. Hard to tell the difference, there is nothing in them.If that was all it would be fine (as it is cheap). But what is shocking is a number of people posing as tour guides but are in fact scammers. One guy would say he would offer a tour for 15dhs. Seems ok. He shows you around for 10 mins and then says it's over and at which point (in an empty room or corridor) starts to tell you about his three children, his poor family etc and tries to extort money out of you. It's quite shocking. I'm a man so I basically pushed past him (he follows). I'd imagine a lot of people would be intimidated by this. I saw his next customer was a woman and I warned her (cue more threats).What surprised me is this is the top rated museum in Marrakech and this happens in the open. Where is the staff or security?Be warned - do not hire any guide in there unless they have a badge (none seem to).

love it. It is worth your time if you happen to be going through 'the door of the desert'. Devoted half a day in Ouarzazate and headed farther.various sets and sitting in the chairs, they really miss an opportunity in the story telling of the museum. While they tell you which room was involved in which film, there was no description of the scenes that took place or the moments that...
Beautiful architecture, well worth a visit!. Well worth a visit to this place as the building is simply stunning! Very close to the Main Square and quick to get around!
Very interesting history.. Interesting building and history. This Islamic college was only for the special privileged few. The architecture is fascinating.

Amazing Architecture. Beautiful architecture, amazing history, cool and serene place to visit. Our guide explained how the school was run, where the scholars slept and learnt, how old the building was, etc etc. V ery interesting place, and amazing carvings everywhere that were done by hand. Inexpensive to visit, but well worth it.

Old dormitory for students. The building was beautiful and it was interesting to see the dark and cramped rooms where students studying at the mosque used to live. It would have been nice to have more sign posts with explanation or some sort of pamphlet available to read.

Beautiful place. A visual delight . if you like architecture then this is a feast for your eyes :) I travelled alone here , I asked a member of staff if he would take a photo of me , and he refused unless I took and paid for a tour with him, another holiday maker oblidged , It cost 20 dihrams entrance , so little for such a beautiful place
An old building. It is just located in the middle of the medina, or the arabic town as they say. There are many restaurant near by, especially El Fondek Restaurant.
An interesting visit. This Madrasa has a long history. It is interesting to have seen but in my opinion not a must see, but I'm sure it would have more relevance to a Muslim.
intresting visit. visit ok, man writing names in Arabic, using calligraphy bamboo pens was highlight for me, there is a charge for him to produce this, but not much.

As close to a madrasa as most of us infidels will get. This was a madrasa, once. Also a mosque. Because it is no longer, nonbelievers can visit. The most interest part for me was the interior courtyard with its artistic inscriptions and the over 100 dorm rooms where the students lived. They're empty now, but close your eyes and imagine what this Islamic school was like, perhaps 800-900 kids learning the Koran. This was one of North Africa's largest Islamic schools.
Stunning. Original architecture. Absolutely beautiful. Do not miss when in Marrakech. A quick and interesting place to visit.

Great Marrakech Attraction. I visited the Madrasa on my first morning in Marrakech and found it to be a great jumping in point for sightseeing in the city and Moroccan history.It was both calm and had beautiful architecture.Afterwards turn right when you come out and on the corner you'll see a small archway leading to the Fondation Dar Bellarj, which was hosting a great photography exhibition about Jemaa El Fna. Also worth a look if you're in the area.
Stunning!. This was beautiful. The stone carving and details is breathtaking. Even more so given that it dates from the 14th century. Definitely worth seeing.
beautiful building. wonderful architecture. interesting history behind this building. very reminiscent of the Alhambra in Andalusia
Beautiful Place, Architectural Marvel. It is a lovely place, we went with a guide which was informative and recommended. It is sell worth a visit, the architecture is amazing.
Just another attraction. Interesting place, especially haunting the rooms upstairs. Tile work is beautiful just like in another 10 places you'll see on tourist maps.

Easy walk-through, beautiful tile work. Worth checking out when in Marrakech. So many small rooms, enchanting hallways and lots of history. The tile work was intriguing and it's located in a nice spot of the medina.

Local culture at its best. I got to the youssef madrasa just as afternoon prayers were ending and joined a throng of people coming from the nearby mosque. Getting to the Madrasa, it looked lonely and old but inside was something else. Lots of places to take great pictures. Lots of intricate designs on the walls, the elegant courtyard, the long narrow corridors. The small windows in the classrooms where you could stand on opposite sides and take pics. Do visit it

Worth a visit. Tucked away in the northern quarter of the city, is a hidden gem. Just when you start getting a bit blinded by all the architecture that Marrakech has to offer, the Ben Youssef Madrasa raises the bar. The courtyard is nothing short of stunning, not only beautiful but a timely reminder that it must have been such an inspirational place to study when it was first opened. There isn't a huge amount of exhibits laid out in this area, bar a selection of large prints donated by the Photography Museum around the corner, however I think anything else would detract from the splendour in front of you. Guides regularly come and go and offer some extra information and insight into the history of the building, but these would have to be booked separately. As you delve into the student halls of residence (for want of a better expression), you start to realise that nothing much has changed in educational establishments in recent year (bar maybe some WiFi and TV dinners...). Certainly worth a visit, and there are lots of opportunity for keen photographers, and at only 10dirham represents excellent value for money.
female solo - 26yrs . Must see. Imagine studying there.... walk a round as if you were a student. Earlier mornings better due to tourists.

Worth seeing in Marrakech. This historic building is notable for its refined Islamic architecture and offers a window into the world of scholastic life in Morocco in centuries past. However, it does not rival the great architectural achievements of Moorish Andalusia . Worth a visit (and it's very reasonably priced) when in Marrakech, but there is not a lot to see - 20 minute visit is sufficient but recommended.

Well worth a visit . This is another typical Marrakech building with some absolutely beautiful doors and tiles. Definitely a must see. There is also a maze of student rooms with detailed carvings around the doors

Beautiful building.. A truly beautiful building with so much to see, a photographers paradise! Amazing architecture. Excellent value entry price. Only downside is no guide/program to explain more about the building, you are reliant on your eyes as any posters/info is in French.
Go with a guide. This school is beautiful but go with a guide or research it well so you will understand the story behind it, otherwise it won't seem as impressive.
Beautiful building . If your into fantastic carving then this place is worth a visit, once used as a school though the dorms are tiny the architecture is amazing.

Magnificent architecture. You must visit Ben Youssef, its incredible detailed walls and scale will leave you feeling amazed. I absolutely loved walking around and taking pictures.
There is an entrance fee, but its well worth it.its very implessive and a great place for taking pictures
Architecturally inspiring. By walking and seeing this amazing place you will understand more of the wonderful history and education of morroco

Definitely visit this madrasa. Having been to one of the Fez madrasa (which we loved) we weren't so sure about needing to go to this one, but were we glad that we did because we got to explore so much more of it that was open to the public in Fez. We got to go into all of the little rooms where the students lived etc and it is a beautiful heritage building
Historic Madrasa in center of Marrakech. Beautiful decorated madrasa in heart of Marrakech.Probably the most beautiful building to visit in Marrakech.

Beautiful Islamic Art. This is a good place to visit for about an hour and a welcome diversion from the souks. One doesn't have to have a deep understanding of the significance of this medersa to appreciate the intricate geometric designs and calligraphy that grace its walls.The serenity of the place allows time for one to see, appreciate and reflect on the contributions to art, design and culture that Moroccans have made
Good for a few photos, very repetitive. Apart from the main courtyard most of this is the same. Go for a few photos and if you're really interested get a guide.

Step into a Time Gone By. Wonderful place to sit in the courtyard and walk the halls. Try to come early to beat the crowds and take photos unobscured by others. Impressive tile and wood work. Stunning example of a Koranic school.

amazing architecture. Good to wander around, admire the architecture and get away from the noise and madness of the traffic and markets outside. However, there are very limited instructions and only in French and Arabic - so you will need some help if you don't understand these two languages.

Good for a short stop to admire the well preserved architecture. There isn't a whole lot to see here but it is worth a quick stop to admire the well preserved architecture and get some great pictures. Not a lot information inside about the actual place and its story.

“Absolutely stunning cant get enough". People always talk about Ben youssef madrasa so this time i went 2 Marrakesh i took time out and went to visit it with my kids & have to say it took my breath away one of the best places we have been only downside was its hard getting there but i found a tour gude name abdul latif and he was verry helpful and we used him for the full day tour of Marrakesh (if anyone wants mobile number of tour guide message me and i will pass it on to ya) make sure u go upstairs in there and look at the small classes were the kids use to study some rooms never even had windows and the heat was over 41c when we went

Loved the historic side!. It was a cheap entry fee. It was beautiful seeing the history side of it all. How children studied there many years back. The building inside is beatific with Arabic verses all over. It was an excellent setting for pictures. I would recommend everyone going Morroco to visit this place!

Beautiful and interesting. We happened into this site while doing other things and I am so glad we did. A great place to take pictures of the family and of amazing designs and shapes. Interesting history and set up as well.
Absolutely stunning - don't miss it. This building is really a treat to visit - exquisite Islamic architecture and interesting plays of shadow and light. Don't miss it.
Beautiful building. Lovely building and features. I visited in the morning before it got too busy and had a peaceful time. Definitely worth a visit.
worth a visit. Beautiful building, if you go early you can have it almost to yourself. Great place to take photos when it is not crowded.

Intricate work. Its humbling when you see a moment with such beautiful and intricate work and realize all this happened well before some developed countries existed!This is well worth a visit. It is close to the main sections of the souks so you can easily weave this into your walk in the centre.
Beautiful building. Lovely trip to look around this site, beautiful architecture and decoration. Very interesting, if you take a guide with you you will understand what everything is
Must see. The architecture is stunning. Unlike some buildings you can walk around on your own and explore the dormitories.
Nice. Went when with a guide who explained alot about what it was used for, was very interesting. Nice to walk around and look at
Gorgeous Architecture. Interesting walkthrough of ancient university dorms and facilities. Must see tiles, woodwork and plaster. Not too much to see but worth the 40 dirham entry fee.

A journey back in time. The madrasa is a journey back in time. The curation could be better but you get a very good idea of what life for the students and teachers was like as you walk through its many rooms and courtyards. A medieval Hogwarts in Morocco where people sent their children to be educated.

Ancient Halls . It's amazing to walk around in this ancient Madrasa and think of all the students who would have worked there. The building is arranged around a central courtyard decorated ornately with brightly coloured tiles, stucco and carved wood. Great opportunity to take some pictures but there is no real shade in this bit so be prepared. Surrounding this are the many many rooms the students used to live in. These are very plain looking in comparison but all a little different so worth exploring.
Beautiful. The building was amazing. A labyrinth of rooms overlooking a courtyard with a looking pool. I can imagine how busy this was a school. The upstairs rooms are simple and quaint
Small and free. A small place worth checking out as it's totally free. No explanations in English so hard to spend much time. But if you're walking past then Pop in!
Was expecting more. Beautiful and relaxing escape from the Medina. Interesting to see how the scholars of Islam used to live and study all those years ago.

Good overview of Islamic architecture. Worth to see at the beginning of your trip. You will see only the Medersa, but it's worth it. Preserved in a perfect state beautiful mosaics and carvings. For me, Medersa is a bit empty. Would be nice to see some exposition or maybe at least one furnished room.

Beautiful half morning. It pays to get here early before the tour groups. Start downstairs while you can still admire the decorations in your own time without jostling with the selfie-stick crowds. Total visit time about 2 hours. There is no information posted inside so if you don’t have a guide do some research beforehand to know what you are looking at.

Sufi Saint visit. I have visited all 7 sufi saints in Marrakesh and this was near one of them. Great experience and remember if you wish visit all 7 tombs then must use a small auto car as these located in well populated area in narrow street and hard to locate , however it very easy for local driver and you won't waste your time.
Spirtually uplfting. We stopped here as it seemed a fascinating place. Very calming and spiritual place to be. (this is used as a mosque so please be respectful and wear modest clothes)

Opportunity for more. This place was a little disappointing because although it is a very historic building, it would be nice if more was done to give an idea of what the place was like for those who studies here when it was a theological college. It would not take much to kit out a couple of the many empty rooms to give the appearance of how it would have been at the time. The entrance fee is reasonable so no complaints with the value for money, just would like to have learned more about it.One thing to watch out for (more so here than anywhere else in Marrakech) is the guides touting outside the entrance, the ones here seemed more pushy and intimidating than others in Marrakech and that is a little off putting.
Beauty. This is a really beautiful attraction, super cheap to get into and 100% worth a visit! Go in the morning as apparently it can get quick busy in the afternoon..

Another side of Marrakech: it's culture . Medersa is the school of islam. Usually linked to the mosque.This one is, not only the most important of Marrakech, but also a good place to understand how the students live(d) their experience there.Worth to visit.

Interesting piece of Moroccan history . The architect is stunning. Great photo opportunity . Very cheap entrance fee. I felt a bit creeped out when upstairs . It felt more like an asylum / institute where people were tortured rather than a college .

Interesting school to Visit. Nice Place to visit in marrakech,very interesting architect we enjoyed the diferent people and cultures histories. we hope next time go back and stay more days and enjoy mores school and kasbas.
Don't bother . Not much to see here. We went with a guide who told us some information but there really isn't that much to tell. This is just a lot of empty rooms and not worth the entrance fee

A place to visit! . I would highly recommend visiting this place. It's full of history and the architecture is beautiful and amazing. We visited here with a guide which was a great way to learn all about it. A great place to take photos. It is not expensive and does not take so long to visit.

Really worth a visit. Another place i would recommend visiting while in Marrakech. I like my history (no expert) and i enjoy seeing the different cultures, so wont be for everyone, but i think it would be a shame not to visit a place like this. Again it is relatively cheap.

Must see!. This medrassa was so mesmerizing and heartwarming to visit. Very intresting too see how beautifull and simpel they have Livee and studies in this school! I would love to visit it again with a guide!

Upstairs Dorms Accessible Too. Well worth visiting to see the historic architecture, intricate artwork and upstairs dormitories. It's our eighth day in Morocco and I've not been to a Madrasa/university where the upstairs are open to the public too. Entrance fee is 20 dirhams/US$2 per person - bargain.
Amazing place. Highly recommend this historical masterpiece and a recollection of how the Madrasa would have been like in the olden days. The artwork is breathtaking.
Nice architecture. This is a major building in Marrakech with a high historic value. it is one of the places to visit while staying in this city.
Very impressive!. One of the oldest in Morocco with rich carvings everywhere, a large number of residential quarters for students and very impressive!

Beautiful Spot. Very cheap entrance fee, and worth every penny. I saw lots of people taking engagement photos, graduation photos, and wanderlust selfies here, and I can see why! It is gorgeous and historical.

Worth a visit. The entrance fee is very reasonably priced, considering the building maintenance relies on this money. The architecture alone is a reason to visit, it feels like walking around a piece of history, untouched by the modern day. There are signs directing you to the building however I suggest you take a map, like most buildings in Marrakech it was hard to find.

Quite good. Worth a quick visit. Although limited information there if you don't speak French/Arabic.The mosaics/ceilings are pretty and worth a look/photo. Would spend no more than 30 mins here. Thankfully, it's fairly centrally located and only a stone's throw away from the main souks.

Peaceful. Rested here for a while after a day in the bustling medina. Talked to some local people who told us a little bit about the Madrasa.Read more about our experience here: https://mypassengerdiaries.wordpress.com/2016/07/06/the-marrakech-medina/

Amazing Architecture. It s ver nice plc to see how to make education for the ppl.Very nice aechitecture.lots of atuff are hand carving and painting..Unbelievable. you have to go up and see the classes upstairs!.
Nice .... Is a must to do during your trip to Marrakech, it is not far from the the main Plaza de Jemaa el fmaa
Interesting visit. Interesting as a non Muslim to see a place like this. Beautiful Islamic mosaics and lots of photo opportunities. Worth spending an hour here.

Beautiful. A beautiful building and worth a visit. I'd suggest reading a bit about it or going for a guide as there is very little information, but at 20 DH it's great to go. Close to some of the central museums too.
Nice place!. Really interesting place. It used to be the school they teacher the coran rules to children, so they have little rooms, beautiful decoration. A must do in Marrakesh!

Interesting!!. It is a beautiful ancient building hiding in the medina. Very hard for the taxi to get there through the narrow streets. You can enjoy the carving in the walls and the cieling. Beautifull art, but there is no information to tell you what these rooms for or the daily life in that biulding, so read in advance if you want to enjoy your first.Last thing, I felt that place is neglected by the government. A lot of writings on the walls, broken walls. They need to take care more of that building.

A must see building. This place is striking, unforgettable. You will want to take at least a few photos here. The architecture and the carving work they did in walls and ceiling in different materials is truly unique. I have done a lot of international travel and love it when I something I have never see before and that I know I will remember. This was one of those moments, one of those places.

Interesting visit. Beautiful building hidden in the Medina. It was a pity the info was only in Arabic and French as I'm sure we missed out on a lot of interesting history. That being said, I would definitely recommend visiting, maybe with a guide.
Beautiful. we spent an hour wandering around here. The architecture is beautiful. Worth a visit, recommend visiting early or late to avoid crowds.
Another Marrakech highlight. We really enjoyed our visit and loved the stunning architecture and history. Highly recommend visiting the site on your visit to Marrakech.

Well worth the trip out. Thus is a great day out but be prepared do a lot of walking. Take plenty of water and a hat.The history of the place oozes from every corner and takes back to a time long gone. Excellent tour guides who also bring the place alive
One of my favorite parts of Marrakech. You must see this. The architecture is simply beautiful. Make sure to include it in your tour of the medina.

An interesting slice of Moroccan history. It was enlightening to see the physical space that male students learned in. The open spaces around the Medrasa Ben Youssef.This location is well kept and a must for tourists to see in Marrakech.
Beautiful architecture. Great value for money combined with stunning Islamic architecture. This really is a must see for tourists in Marrakech.
Excellent Herigate Museum. We visited Ben Youssef Museum and it was brilliant, i would definietely recommend visiting this historic site
Interesting - worth a visit. A very interesting visit here - it's worth getting a guide who can explain the history of the location. Beautiful architecture.

Amazing look into past. Really nice to have a walk around such a historic place, which I believe at one time use to have 900 pupils learning the Quran. The architecture on some of the walls are amazing, only 20dh to get in. We didnt have a tour guide, although in hindsight we maybe should have!.
Beautiful .. Another must see sight in the city.For a place where there are allegedly few sights this is one of the most interesting .

Mosaics :). Loved going to this madrasa. Shows how they valued education and took care of their boarders. The tile work the mosaics are very interesting. Wood work had quite some details too. Worth seeing this gem.

Wonderful building. A wonderful and affordable place to go back in time to see the student quarters and the main hall. To think that this place used to be a center for learning, a high school before high schools even became a thing in the West.

Beautiful Mosiacs. An interesting place to visit, easy enough to walk to from main square, lots of mosaics and worth spending a bit of time wandering around the medersa checking out the little side rooms

Nice architecture. For 20dh this university/museum has a nice aechitecture. The crafting on stones and wood is nice. Went in July and there was no water in the middle pool but I guess that didn't matter too much.

great. It is a lovely place with lots of turists, near the museum which is great
The seconf floor is amazig
Nice place. Nice place, really not much to see though. Hire a guide if you wanna learn something about that place.

Brilliant history. A serious must visit.. A muslim reviewer - A serious must see to expeiance and see how this was a madrasha ( college/univerisity) of old age for women and men which was of harvard/oxford status of it's time. So beautiful!!
Awesome Architecure & Craftwork. A beautifully ornate building in the heart of the Medina just minutes from the Marrarkech Museum , one for the lovers of Architecture and design.

very interesting tour. The tour was very informative, but a bit tiring as it was very hot, which in my mind took the edge off it, but that was my problem not the tour itself,a good half a day.well worht it.

Well worth finding !. Beautiful tiles, doors and ceilings. Loads of amazing photo oppertunties. Small enterance fee. Sadly no information in English, you just have t admire it. Take water as nowhere to get a drink.

Nice but not great. This is an average sight to visit. If you have visited other Arabic countries and their monuments you will not be amazed. The fountain was completely dry. But it is not expensive (2€) so it is worth the visit.
Interesting. This place is interesting for its history and also the architecture. As other reviewers have said a guide does help with the experience.

Cedar wood ceiling vaults... Stepping into time...can imagine students darting in and out of rooms for their Koran classes..and at the time of prayer..can imagine the voice of the imam resonating in the cavernous main hall..mesmerising and beautiful inscription of the verses of the Koran along the walls. Please respect these verses of the Koran by not photographing them. If you do then please keep photos Stored in a covered envelope and handle with respect.

Good to see . We went here with our tour guide who told us about the history of the place. You need a tour guide with you as there is no guide on offer at the museum. You can walk around and get pictures.
Beautiful. Visiting here is a must beautiful architect & colour. Hard to believe you are only a thick wall away from the busy noisy alleyways of this amazing city
Beautiful old school. This old Islamic school is a must see in Marrakech. Very beautiful and interesting to get an idea of what life used to be like here.

Stunning and full of interest. We visited twice, once with a guide from our riad and once alone. The guide really added to the experience, teaching us about the layout and structure of the university. The first visit, we just soaked up everything with our eyes and avoid the temptation of the camera, but we just had to go back to take a few snaps! Really gorgeous place. Tip - if you go with a guide, buy the tickets yourself. Once bought, you can go back in again for free. We learnt this the hard way!
Touristic attraction. Very nice place to visit as a touristic attraction in Marrakesh. The school is very old with unique stories behind each room.

Nice old Building . Nice old Building and interesting History. Entrance 30 Dirham which is alright. You can get a Guide which explains everything for you, but we have Done it without one. Don't forget to Go upstairs and take a picture looking out of the Windows

Fascinating!. A wonderful place to wander around. Trying to imagine being a scholar here 100s of years ago is mind blowing. Calm and quiet inside.NOTE: Entrance is small and not well signed. Young men outside tried to tell us it was closed and tried to take us to another 'attraction'. Be calm and firm, it is open and it is well with visiting!

Great place. The Sunni form of Islam places a lot of very strict constraints on architects and decorators which are noticeably absent in the Shia form. Struct Sunni Islam bans the depiction of people, animals and the like and with that in mind, artisan craftsmen developed highly decorative design styles that rely on the use of geometric patterns and calligraphy. As so often happens, constraints can force creativity rather then restrict it if you're determined enough to pursue beauty. Technique include the use of tiling, painting, wood and stone carving and stuccowork, all of which are in evidence at the Ben Youssef Medersa.

Part of souk tour - known as 'old school'. After a hot and busy stroll through the souk with our uninterested guide supplied through our hotel, he led us down many side passages to this beauty - an old school with over 130 rooms for those who were educated there. I loved the tiling, the cedar wood detail and exploring the dorm rooms. Cost just 20dirham each and welcome break from the midday sun.

Quick stop, but a good one!. We popped in only about an hour before they were closing and we were able to see everything in about 30-45 minutes. Beautiful tile work and exploring the old classrooms and dorms was interesting. The courtyard is like a fantasy and makes for some great photo backdrops. Not a lot of history or information provided, but cool to take a peek in the space.

Boring. Yes, it is old and beautiful in it's own way. But if you are not that deep in Arabic culture, you will get bored there very soon. There is no information about the place's history inside, so it is better to have a guide or to read in advance
Blown away . The architecture is unbelievable, so detailed and it's fascinating to walk around, the workmanship is so skilled. You need to pay an entry fee but it is worth it!

Stunning craftsmanship. I recommend coming early in the morning before everyone gets there. The art work and craftsmanship is amazing. Be sure to come with a guide otherwise you are just looking at a beautiful building.

Beautiful Madrasa and a peek to Islamic architecture. Amazing architecture and lots of photography opportunities (if patient). We particularly enjoyed exploring the rooms on the second floor and observing the crowd below.

Interesting architecture but not a lot to see. We visited the madrassa during our walking tour of the Medina. It was interesting to see and cost about 10 dirhams per person. The architecture was interesting to see and learn about the living conditions inside the madrassa, but without any furniture or displays to see, the amount you can learn from it is limited. I'd also say that there are better examples you could go to instead like the home of the vizier which was much larger and prettier.
beautiful islamic architecture. lovely building we had a great guide which I reccomend. This is worth seeing for the beautiful carving tiles and islamic decoration

Very impressive. The Madrasa is a must-see in Marrakesh. While my expectations were relatively low, I was blown away. The architectural details of this school are amazingly impressive. Every little corner seems to have been finely crafted. Beyond its architecture, the Madrasa will allow you to find out how students were living in the past. It has indeed a historical value that you will probably clearly feel.
Nice to see. Nice place to take a few photos, that's about it. It's a very old building and preserved extremely well.

Okay bit disappointing. The entry fee is 10dirham. It was a bit broken down and pretty much the same throughout.The highlight for me was the kittens who simply followed you about. They loved being picked up and stroked but were dirty and matted. Anyway its part of the history of marrakech so should visit. Takes about 20 mins.
Definitely see this!. Beautiful architecture and very calming inside. Definitely take the time to stop by and see this old school.
Wonderful place. It was an amazing place to visit and I really liked it, the zelliji and the structure were beautiful!
The best Medieval attraction in Marrakech.. The architectural details are beyond belief and incredible to have survived so many centuries. High recommend!
Interesting architecture. Well worth a visit and best appreciated with a guide who can explain its history fully. Beautiful building with lovely wood carvings.
Breathtaking . One of the most beautiful buildings I've ever been in. The amount of detail is astounding. Absolutely one of the highlights of my trip to Morocco.

Beautiful architecture. Best to read up on its history before you get there, to appreciate the design and function of this gorgeous building. The smaller chambers and layout are fascinating. You'll get lost in the geometry of the designs!

Small Alhambra. If you are interested history and architecture , it certainly worths a visit. Most of the interior designs will remind the Alhambra.It is a bit difficult to find it because the local people confuse it with the mosque near it .

An ancient Koranic school. Very interesting and beautiful madras with a fascinating history. The woodwork and decorations are lovely, and one needs to constantly remind oneself that this was all hand done!
Africa museum. All in French with no English translation available during our visit. Beautiful history of Western Africa that we could gather .

One of the few quiet places in a Marrakech. Easy to find, only follows table on the streets. Very cheap entry around 2 euro, but nothing interesting from inside. But good like place for relax from the busy streets.

SURRISE VISIT TO THIS LITTLE GEM. We came across this on a visit to the Souks and didn't know there was an old school where children stayed to learn the Koran. It was 20 Dirham to go in but worth it for a look back in history.
Interesting. Ben Youssef Madrasa was a really lovely building, but similarly with other historic places in Marrakech there isn't enough information to truly appreciate what it was about.
dont skip this. Don't skip this. Wandering through the 12 th century islam college. Only middle court is crwoded explore beatiful rooms in complex.
Pretty. The detail in the architecture is really amazing; you have to see it up close. Go with a guide since there's no audio guide.
Lovely. Lovely place to visit, and so many cute spots to pictures with. Definitely will go to this place and then to the museum which is right beside it.

A Key Part of Marrakech. The Madrasa is in the heart of Marrakech and next to, almost embedded in, the souks. It is a remarkable piece of architecture and a very interesting part of the history of the city. The major part of the magnificent building is in glorious condition, although there is a need for repair and restoration in various areas - it looks like dilapidation is setting in. That said, this is a 'must-see'.

Dare I Say It? I Was A Bit Bored!. Yes, this is a lovely building. It is a nice (short) stop if you are going past. However, I really didn't find this as interesting as Bahia Palace, or many of the other 'iconic' buildings I've been to. I think we were there for 15 minutes and that was enough. There's really not that much to see or do.

Don't really understand why people like it so much. There are a lot of beautiful buildings in Marrakech. This one is fine, but I could have happily given it a pass. Once you enter one room, the rest looks very similar and I didn't think the historical part of it was particularly well presented. But I have heard a lot of people raving about it, so perhaps I'm missing something.I was most intrigued by the toilets. I'm not even sure why, but I they look kind of different and the whole way the bathroom attendant was handling things just seemed very different to what I'm used to in places I've been before.
Cool place for photos. Very interesting museum. It used to be a school in the past. It is well preserved and, if you like taking pictures, this is a nice spot.
Amazing. build in the 1600, this place is most amazing,certainly worth a visit and right in the medina. Not to be missed

Interesting to look at but not much else. As with most places in Marrakech, the architecture was beautiful but the whole thing is very basic. There wasn't much information given, and even on the website it was very brief. The fountain in the middle didn't have water in, which took away from the courtyard. This may have just been due to the time of year, as this was the case with most fountains we saw. For the price it's till worth a look.

Very peculiar building. The entry is really cheap (10-20 MAD) and it is really worth the visit. It was a coranic school and not only is the architrcture of thr building itself stunning, but it also allows you to visit the tiny cells used by th estudents of the time. Really interesting and different from everything else you will see in Marakesh

Don't miss this amazing place - its just stunning. We weren't sure what we would find here but it is absolutely amazing.The tiles and plasterwork decoration are spectacular.If you go upstairs - and not many people seemed to - there are lots of little chambers and the view from them into the central courtyard is wonderful.When you realise how old this building is it is truly amazing - it is at the heart of the medina but we found it on our own and the fee is very reasonable.The only disappointment was there was no water in the courtyard pool - if this is the only historical site you visit I am sure you won't be disappointed.
Beautiful place . Situated in the Marrakech old town area. The ticket is 10 I think - not expensive. The place is beautiful with impressive decorations - perfect illustration of the rich culture!

Great to have a guide to provide some history of this beautiful Place. The Madrasa is centuries old established in 1000 ad and was a school and university that brought students from across the world , at a time when Europ was still in the dark ages. The architecture is beautiful ad I was able to capture some beautiful shots. Take I guide if you are interested in the history of the school, certainly worth it.
Spectacular mosaics. A magnificent Islamic madrassa. A glimpse into another era of sumptuous art and spiritual devotion. Do not miss if in Marrakesh
Amazing. Worth the visit. I enjoyed visiting this place. There is a lot of history here. It is quite large and also provides plenty of photo opps.
Great architecture. Brilliant authentic moroccan architecture and chance to learn a lot if you go there with a local guide.

WOW!. By far my favourite place to see in Marrakech after Le Jardin Majorelle - slightly tricky to find but once you do it's an incredibly beautiful and charming place to see. Definitely worth the 20Dhs to get in!

Nice for a quick visit... Not much to see . It's a lovely building with an interesting history but not much to see really... Some of the architecture is beautiful in the main courtyard, but once you venture off that it's all very same-samey.The dorm rooms (obviously not the correct term) are identical to one another so don't keep walking off into a new section hoping to see something new. A nice one to tick off in you're in the area but I wouldn't make a special effort to visit.

Amazing building. A real piece of history and well worth a visit. The detail in the stucco and wooden beams is incredible and ornate detail around the main square is simply stunning. It's also in need of some renovation work but is pretty well preserved given the age and history.
Nice. Its not a very big place, but you can see how small and uncomfortable the classrooms were in those days and the bedrooms were tiny too, Pretty interesting

Architecture. Visited this place recently at the suggestion on guide. It's in the Medina near main square and definitely worth spending a short time there. It reminded me of some of the designs at the Alhambra but on a much smaller scale
Incredible piece of architecture!. Ben Youssef Madrasa is incredibly beautiful inside and out. It's a great place to visit when the heat get's a little too much a mid day.

A step back in tome. Such a wonderful place to check out:
- a nice break from the hustle going on outside
- so much history. You get to walk around freely and check out every nook and cranny
- beautiful architecture and Moroccan aesthetics
Too bad everything is in French and very little info it provides otherwise
Must see when in Marrakesh. loved this experience. Very interesting visit. I was also lucky to have a great tour guide. Strongly recommend
gorgeous architecture. This is an amazing building. I wish there were placards posted with historical information in English.
Amazing . Really nice. Just not that much to see because a lots of the rooms are closed. Great architecture and amazing to think that you were visiting the oldest university in the world.

Not to be missed. A must see when in Marrakech. Both from historical point of view if you are interested in the rich history of this school which trained many scholars or the sheer beauty and elegance of the architecture of the building.Don't forget to go upstairs and into one of the rooms to feel how hundreds of years ago students would have lived there.Don't miss it.
Beautiful but needs a guide. The building is really nice but without any signs so you dont know what you are seing. If you find a guide perhaps the experience gets better
Don't miss it. Beautiful and historic value, carvings and architecture go early Morning when iT is quiet and imagine that once about 800 students were there
Very interesting. The architecture is amazing, there isn't much information available so I'd recommend downloading an article online to accompany the visit.

A must see in Marrakech. This is a truly beautiful building with a rich history and a must see stop on your tour of Marrakech. A visit to the Madrasa is a way to immerse yourself in the culture and history of Marrakech. The Madrasa was a school, but is not a museum showing how life once was in Marrakech.
Amazing architecture. The madrassa is really incredible-such detail in the workmanship highly recommended. it was nice to have a break from the warm day as well.

Beautiful building with no storytelling. Beautiful intricate decorations everywhere - a pity though that without a guide you won't be able to tell the I believe great story of this used to be majestic Islamic school. It was done in 20 minutes

Very nice architecture!. Nice buildings, very calm and nice visit - it was not crowdy at all which was much appreciated.
There is some hidden places so make sure to visit all the rooms first and ground floors.

It's a nice visit but not as interesting as we hoped . Lovely architecture and such like however it becomes a bit samey. They need examples of the work by students and displays or text for reading. Guards were also pretty grumpy about everything - be nice to people and they're more likely to come back and leave good reviews!

Interesting but only if you have extra time. The madrasah is impressive for its architecture, but only add it if you have plenty of time. The tile work and wood carving can be found in more worthwhile places like the Bahia Palace.
Interesting Architecture. Not much history and all the signs are in French, but it is part of the overall experience/sits of Marrakech. You can knock this site out in 30 minutes or so.

Worth the visit. Our private your guide took us here today. Explained the Islamic education system and showed us the spaces where students used to gather for morning prayer and study. Then we explored the upstairs dormitories. He explained that dark rooms were for the worst students, rooms that opened to courtyard and had biggest windows were for top students and average for average. We enjoyed assessing which room we would like the most.

Magnificent Moroccan Architecture. Ben Youssef Madrasa is a stunning piece of Moroccan architecture and design. We visited it as part of a guided tour of the city and our guide was able to tell us the history of the building, who used it and what each room was used for. I thought it was truly remarkable how the original artwork is still intact and as vibrant as the day it was painted hundreds of years ago.
Interesting, Cheap, Culture-Filled. Take time from the bustling souk to explore Ben Youssef. Architecture and history well worth entrance fee.
AWESOME. Beaaaauuuuuutifuuuuuullllllllll and interesing. The cost for the visit is only 20 dhs. Great place to take pictures. go:)

Love love love!! Worth visiting!. Took a while to find it as it's in the midst of the medina/souks through an alley way. There are signs giving directions but they are not obvious! There will be some young kids trying to help you find the place but they will expect money in return!Once we got there, I was happy we came here, the beautiful interior still exists that was once a school, still kept in pristine condition and with most of the stunning architecture still remains.Also, it only cost 20dhs (about £2.00) to visit, well worth paying!! Truly recommended!
Very unusual. Unusual and cool building to explore. The architecture was fantastic and the decor was stunning. Will definitely go again.
Impressive. The Madrasa is a former islamic school, with an impressive architecture and with beautifully decorated walls. However, the place lacks some conservation, but it certainly worths a visit.
Interesting place to see. You can see how the students of Islamic college lived. Founded in the 14th century. Dormitories for 130 people, a beautiful courtyard carved in cedar, marble and stucco.
beautiful place. The madrasa is a beautiful place that is maintained well. With pretty tilework and carved courtyards.
Beautiful!. We had a tour guide who described the history of this school, which was very helpful. I recommend it.
Take a step back in time.... The courtyard, the opulent carving, tile, and woodwork harken back to a bygone age. Wonderful arches, secluded rtooms for the students...

Great place. This is quite an interesting place to visit. Apparently it is or has been the largest theological Islamic school in Morocco with accommodation for hundreds of students. Architecturally it is quite beautiful and for this reason alone it deserves a visit.

Beautiful . Not much to review, it was spectacular. For those that enjoy in depth analysis of the place a tour guide in here might be good, as I am well read about the place I knew most of it, but only seeing it by my own eyes was magical. Worth paying money for this if you payed money to travel all the way to the city. Make sure to have a camera with you to take some nice shots.

cool place to escape. From the heat of the day this is a wonderful escape. A beautiful building with intricate woodwork and carvings. The mosaics are beautiful. The nice thing is that you can wander around the rooms and get an idea of what the students lives were like. Most of the rooms are small and opened onto the centre square, some have no windows at all.

Top spot. Beautiful, tranquil and well presented the opportunity to freely roam around this madrasa and be impressed by its scale, splendour and even the detail of the individual cells. A wonderful place that could benefit from some additional informative displays.
Architecturally stunning.. A wonderful stop while wondering through the Medina. Good photo stop. The woodwork and mosaic are stunning. Some of the best we saw.
The School. Full of history and beautiful. Once a school, you see some of the most beautiful architecture created. To anyone appreciating the art this is the place to go to see, learn and appreciate

Great if you can find it. .....but you won't find it! At least not on your own. You will only find this place with one of the guides that will surround you the second you step of a bus! Use a guide...

Beautiful and a must see . We paid a standard tourist fee for entry, i believe about 20 dhs, getting in to the madrasa can be a bit difficult depending where u get dropped of. Its sooooo beautiful! Real taste of morocco great place for a moment to think, relax and ofcourse take loads of pictures. Highly recommend visiting here
Very special and interesting. A must in Marrakech. Amazing architecture and history and cultural place, go and take time to learn all about it.
Worth a trip . We visited a lot of madersas while we in Fes and this one was one of our favorites. Great architecture and worth a look, even if it's not your first madersas.

Great carved wooden work. Worth seeing.. I almost believed some reviews about the this place that it's not worth a visit. Luckily, I decided to give a try and found out that it was an amazing place though not that good comparing to any other well preserved historical places. The craftsmanship was impeccable. And the architecture was outstanding. Give yourself an hour to witness how this place was made and rich in details.
beautiful place. its a nice place to visit, very old and so interested to explore, very traditionnel, i like it so much,
Great Architecture . Great architecture, but not much else to look at tbh. Little areas which help explain the boarding house. Shame as we were expecting much much more. Worth a visit for 20 mins
One of the best places to see. This is as unique a place as you'll find in Marrakech. We loved it for the ornate tiling, the architecture and the history that comes with a place like this.
Not that impressive. I personally found this boring, although it provides a quiet space to relax if you need to get away from the Medina chaos.
Very educational and beautiful architechture. Well worth taking the time to go and look around. Beautiful buildings and a great incite into the history of scholars.

Beautiful architecture . I had a guide booked by my hotel show me around so this was one of our stops. I would recommend a guide as he was able to explain the history and importance of the place. But a lovely place to visit nonetheless.
Best Madrasa in Morroco. I haven't been to all Madrasa in Morroco of course, but this one was very impressive! The 10 or 20 DH fee is worth it. Skip the one in Fes and go to this one!!
Stunning architectural site. This medersa, or religious school, is beautifully restored. It's an excellent opportunity to see the richness and yet austerity of the medersa. Highly recommended.

a MUST visit in Marrakech - incredibly beautiful architecture. This museum was once a reknown Muslim Universtity. Sigh, I wished my University looked like that!! It is, in my opinion, the finest detailed architecture I have seen in Marrakech, so beautiful, it overwhelmed me. Not large grounds, but plenty of fine details, doors, ceilings, tiles, archways that you can either goggle at or photograph ;-)
Wonderful. A truly beautiful madrasa. It is a must for everybody in Morocco looking for architecture and history.

Beautiful architecture but... Could be much better with some information explaining the significance of various sections of the structure but this seems to be the case with most of historical monuments in Marrakech.
A bunch of empty rooms and a nice courtyard. Not sure what's impressive about this place. About 5 minutes is enough to see everything that's there to see.
An interesting stop . The architecture is cool and a lot of the tile work is nice, but the madrasa is crowded, not that big and upstairs it's pretty repetitive.

Interesting school!. We spent an hour walking around the place and it was worth seeing. Careful when you exit as there will be people wanting you to go to the tannery as today is the last day of a special auction...ya right...they take you to the tannery and ask you for money (as you will not be able to find your way back) to return you to the school! Fortunately we did not fall for this "scam" but plenty of others did......

Amazing intricate architecture, must see!. The many rooms where students used to stay are a wonder to look at. I'd recommend going in the afternoon when sunlight is warmer, makes everything look magical.

Best attraction. You have to visit, the ornate architecture knocks you for 6. However, it's murderously difficult to find and be very careful when you leave, we got completely lost and ended up at the tanneries the complete opposite of where we wanted to go

Worth a visit. We went there in the morning on our last day. We have seen photos from TA but it does not do its justice. It is a highly recommended place to visit to see how they lived. An architectural must.
A must see. Not to be missed on a visit to Marrakech. Please remember to ask for your ticket when you pay the entry fee. Just to ensure that the cashier isn't pocketing your money.

ok. Wish there were some artifacts in the rooms , at least give a person some idea of living conditions.They should dress the men in black standing around in period costumes .Give visitors bit more than beautiful walls and tiles
You should see. This is a very fine building. However what surprised us is that we could not see any guides or at least some info about the history and the usage, on the walls etc.
Beautiful mosque. What a beautiful and lovely building. Such history and stunning architecture. Interesting and well worth a visit - don't forget the camera.
Stunning decor. I really enjoyed walking around the old boys school. I found a hidden room with tons of writing all over it. this place is super photogenic and a must see. it cost 20 mad to get in.

Architectural highlight of old Marrakesh. Close to 1000 years old this Islamic college is notable for its beautiful tiled walls and central courtyard with pool. Well worth an hour or so especially to get away from the heat and bustle of the medina

Awazing structure. We had a guide when we visited Ben Youssef and feel that we benefited from his mine of information. Such and interesting building and its history. The carvings are amazing and the architecture astounding, you will be mesmerized by its beauty.

Wonderful architecture at a cheap price. Old school nestled near the souk at a cost of approximately $2 per person. Would have been nice to get a visitor pamphlet since all the few signs posted were in french.
Great architecture. We enjoyed our visit here. This very old building has some of the best architecture in the city. Some interesting displays too.

Glimpse a life in Islam rarely seen. While the Madrassa has long been in disuse, the lives of the thousands of students and teachers who once lived in this huge well preserved building are palpable. Even devoid of all furniture there is something about the many tiny cell like rooms of the community open a view rarely seen by a westerner.Take your time to wander and imagine!66

All looks the same. Intreasteimg but best part of their place is the walk through the souks. All the places looks the same, tombs, places, all mosaic tiles and carvings. Very peaceful in the chaos of the city

Fun to wander around inside. I went here on my own without a guide. When it was in use as a religious school, it could house up to 900 students. Seeing where they slept (in small dorm rooms) made me think about all those boys reciting the Quran and learning their other subjects together in the middle of the Medina. The little doors and windows in the students' rooms are charming. The main courtyard and its tile work (zillij) were the largest I saw at any medersa in Morocco, and there are several magnificent carved wood ceilings. You can go up to the second floor and peer out the windows into the courtyard, getting a completely different perspective on this traditional architectural style. The building was completed in 1565 and is in beautiful condition. I really enjoyed spending time here, and it was not overrun with tours! Easy to find at the north end of the souks in the Medina.
Found by chance ... lucky us!. Interesting historical old school/college - worth having a walk round with some beautiful ornate fretwork.

Great architecture. This is a stunning building. The architecture is beautiful and the decor ornate. You can not here the hustle and bustle of the surrounding area. Very peaceful and well worth visiting.

Beautiful Islamic architectur. Stunningly decorated with every square inch of the lower floor covered with intricate tile work or carvings. Be sure to explore the upper level where the tiny warren of rooms where the students and teachers lived are vastly different than the bottom floor. To really appreciate what went on in this building, be sure to have a good guide book, or better, a local guide to explain the history of this interesting structure.

Stunning Structure!. Yet another beautiful building to explore in Marrakech. The carvings all around are just stunning.
Interesting to see the warren like environment in which the students would have lived.
Well worth the 20d entry fee.

Amazing!!. You will be totally stunned with the precision and the beauty of the architecture . The place is full of ornaments and beautiful work starting from ceiling to floor .You will get a real great time walking around and watching it.The bad part is thag it's located in a place where taxis can not very close toSo you'll have to walk in very crowded streets to get to it.You can get lost easily so follow the signa whenever possible or keep asking around the people are really helpful and will be happy to help you find your way
Amazing site. What a charming place away from the Souks, so peaceful, architect fascination, interesting facts and worth a visiti.

I´d want to study in such a place. Originally it was a building of university, where you can see even the dorms where the students used to live in. Beautiful architecture, you won´t know where to look first. Don´t forget to keep looking up on the ceilings! Definitely a must when visiting Marrakech.

Outstanding cultural stop. This is one of those places in the world that can express cultural history and values simply through visual representation. Ladies, please come dressed sensitively to cultural norms; cover yourself (legs, arms, shoulders, head).

Yes, a must in Marrakech.. I agree with what has been said about this Madrasa as a must while in Marrakech. It won't take you much time to visit, but learning a bit of history will really open your understanding of the place: either go with a guide or read a bit about it in advance!

Beautiful architecture . This building is well worth a visit. The decorations are stunning, in a traditional style, and well maintained. It was not too crowded so we could easily stroll through at our own place. Given that you can't go into any of the mosques in Marrakesh, this is one of the best options to see this style of architecture.

A little 'samey' . We spent a while trying to find this in the maze of the Medina - it was worth the walk and reasonably priced but nothing overtly special. Once you had seen one part of the building you had seen it all. Nice space to escape from the afternoon sun. Would have enjoyed it more if there had been more information inside available in English as our French is pretty basic.
Amazing building. Great place to visit, however the history and signs are all in French and Arabic so I could not understand (I know shame on me for expecting English) but worth a visit all the same.

Nice sculpted courtyard, go early to avoid crowds. The sculpted courtyard is worth the visit.It tended to get crowded by 10:30 in the morning so I recommend going early, especially if you want to take pictures.

Most authentic Medersa in Morocco. We first visited the Medera Bou Inania in Fes and it is really beautiful, but we have to say that the Ben Youssef Mersa is superior to the one Fes cause the architecture is much more detailed, you can also have a look in the upper floors and the dormitories of the students and at least only less tourists go there.

Brilliant Mosque . Loved this place. Upon entering the Madrassa you feel a cool almost air conditioned atmosphere. With beautiful history of the Madrassa as you explore and the rooms for the students who would have lived here gave it an almost eerie, haunting feeling with small claustrophobic like rooms. Well worth a visit if you're in Marrakech.

Historical Moroccan Architecture. Recommend a 1/2 day guide for the Medina which includes this site. This site has important historical significance for Marrakech. We enjoyed climbing the stairs and checking out the "dorm rooms" living quarters of this former college.

Beautiful Historic Building. Visited here today and wasn't disappointed - a beautiful building which has been well maintained and represents what comes to mind when thinking about Moroccan architecture. Entry fee 20dhm if wondering.

It's gorgeous and a nice example of architecture and tile work.. It was a lovely place and beautiful to see. Founded in the 13th century and retains a lot of its orginal splendor. Since you can;t visit mosques in Morocco if non-muslim it is a good way to see similar buildings.
Beautiful Building. This place is a must, its beautiful architecture will amaze you, just ask somebody local to tell you the story about this place to really understand the meaning of this building.

Interesting and historical. A very interesting place to go explore - more so if you have a guide with you who can talk you through the individual pieces of history on show here. On the surface it's an impressive old building with some stunning architecture and hard card relief on the surfaces, typical of Islamic art. Underneath there's a lot of intertwined history, significance and different uses that can only be uncovered by spending some time really studying here or having a guide with you.Well worth a look as it's right off the middle of the main market area in Marrakech so you can stop your commercialism for a bit and enjoy some of the deep rich history of the city.
Very special place to see. This is one of the most important sight seeing spots in the Medina. A very old Kurani school. Very picturesque.
The courtyard. A good place to visit while in Marrakech. The most striking feature is the central courtyard considering the entrance tot he Madrasa is through tiny streets.
madrasa history nice pics. it was ok, we went had a look and leftwe wished they had some english translation to explain the history
Beautiful educational institution. All Mederssas in Morocco are very beautiful. Must check all of them out. Once you enter inside you go deep in a vaccum of art.
Must see. Go early in the morning to avoid the crowds. If you see this one and the big one in Fes, you have seen enough Madrasas.

Very impressive. Very impressive old building, you can go in every room!
Very nice location to make photos! Best time for a visit is early in the morning.

Nice stop in the busyness of Marrakech. I would recommend looking into a guide or doing some primary research before you go into the Madrasa. It's a beautiful building that takes you back to circa 1200. It's an interesting combination of ornate and intricate design while maintaining simplicity and modesty. There's many opportunities for photographs, but if you don't speak French or Arabic, the signage will not be of help to you.
Must see. I loved the architecture! Unfortunately the pool was empty but Medrasa is still picture perfect. I highly recommend the visit.

View of the past worth visiting. You can almost hear the echoes of the young scholars who studied here over the centuries as you walk around the madrasa. The architecture is fascinating but perhaps the most interesting part of the visit is looking at the rooms where the young men studied: almost monastic in their spareness, small and many without natural light. The tile work and the plaster decoration is still vibrant after so many years which is amazing. The madrasa is just north of the souks and the main square and is a very nice way to spend 30-45 minutes during a stay in Marrakech.
Nice to see. Nice place to see had my name written in arabic and the place is full of art works and history, its a very calming place to be
interesting stop. beautiful building and interesting historical spot. wonder in and out of the rooms to get a closer look. No markers written in English.
Good photographic opportunities . Excellent place to visit and to see older Moroccan architecture. Beautiful details and tiles and interesting to understand its history as a school

Walking in the footsteps of ancient Scholars. This building is amazing. It is 11th century and used to be a University for 14-24 years of age, male only. Since the building of a new University, this was opened to the public. The artwork is in really good condition, the walls are decorated everywhere. The wood work of which there is plenty is in remarkable condition. Upstairs you will find small cells where the students to live and work. Well worth the visit and paying the small entrance fee
History. Great to see historical building with its original architecture. Would recommend you to go visit this place.
beautiful. small but full of stunning details, north in the medina, easy to miss, but definitely a must if your visiting marrakesh

Stunning site. We really enjoyed this site in Marrakesh. Amazing wall carvings. Fun place for photography. All the little rooms are within reach. As with almost anything in Morocco it is not wheelchair accessible.

Amazing architecture. The entry fee is worth the visit. Its amazing the way the quranic scriptures are embedded throughout the building, must go upstairs to get a view of the rooms and windows. Whilst there I over heard an English guide describe what a madressa is with a slight American twang. "Its a islamic school and not a terrorist training centre" if someone has to really go to those depths I really worry about society.
Historical!. Very beautiful court yard and interesting history of a dormitory where young folks stayed while learning the Koran!
Interesting, with beautiful decor. Definitely worth a couple of hours to visit, and a nice break in the heat of the day. Explanations could be more extensive, but for 10 MAD it's hard to complain.
Interesting and atmospheric, but lacks information. Worth a look, but not a lot of background given. It is in its original state and that adds to the charm.
Beautiful building. We loved our visit here, the building was beautiful and much bigger than I expected it to be. The intricate detail was amazing and very relaxing after the chaos of the souks.
Beautiful!. Loved the intricate detail and the history. A truly beautiful building. My kids were fascinated with the size of the students bedrooms!
A jewel to visit. We loved the Madrasa. The architecture is amazing. The price to get in is very decent. Hence to fully get into Moroccan culture it is a place to visit.

Amazing architecture . This is an amazing place. It is a warren of rooms on two floors and a courtyard. The architecture is fantastic. Almost the entire place is covered in intricate Islamic patterns carved in wood or plaster. The tiling is also amazing.
Great Architecture . Unique architecture and a nice place to explore. As with most of the places to visit in Marrakech it is good value for money.

Wonderful monument.
