Definitely worth seeing; gorgeous example of the Moroccan architecture, design and ornament - unbelievably preserved carved wooden ceilings, complex mosaic tiling (zellij) in traditional vivid colours. Great job done on the renovation. Entrance fees for all Marrakech sights are ridiculously low.

Overpriced but worth a visit. My overall feeling from visiting Ben Youssef Madrasa is that it is overpriced (20 MAD per person) but still worth a visit based on the architecture that you can spot inside. I expected more decorations / pictures showcasing it through the ages but was left a bit disappointed. If you're in a hurry, skip this place as you won't miss out that much.
Beautiful. Stunning building. Go early or late to a oid crowds. Only 20 dm for admission. Not much info available so get a guide or read up ahead of time for info.

Qur'anic school. Perfect place where you can't forget that Marrakech is an Islamic city. It was a Qur'anic school founded in the 14th century and reconstructed in the 16 century. There the scholars used to learn the Qur'an by heart, Islamic laws and sciences.Away from the hustle and bustle of the souks, this "madrassa", with its quiet atmosphere, is definitely a fascinating and refined place to visit.
Rich in Detail. Beautiful very rich in details, craving in the walls, ceiling, everywhere. Peaceful feeling when you enter in there.
beautiful!. My 5 year old and I enjoyed exploring all the little rooms in the school. The walls in the courtyard are magnificent! Definitely worth visiting!

Not much to see. Nothing remarkble, just a set of empty rooms in each floor. It's not costy 20 DH per person and good for taking some photos. No need for taking the giude, internet search is more than enough.
Interesting and stunning. amazing place to visit, the interiors are stunning...also remember to look out the windows onto the street.

Beautiful with lots of history. Beautiful stop, highly recommend for travelers wandering Marrakesh. Was 20 dirham a piece. Beautiful ornate walls and doors, there were signs too that explained a little more history about the building.
Nothing too special . We came here with a guide and he did a good job explaining what this place is all about, it's an old school with lots of rooms for students to study.
A dormitory. This building is a must see as it is one of the most ornate ones in town. Surprisingly it was used as a dormitory for advanced learning school! It is gorgeous and full of history.

Wonderful. Went with my partner and we both thoroughly enjoyed it. Entry fee was 20Dhr each, we both took some lovely photos of the building and the fantastic architecture in the main courtyard. Guides are offered for 50Dhr but you don't need them unless you want to know the history of the building in depth (a quick Google search can be just as useful) would recommend, a great way to kill an hour or so.

Quite stunning.... Hard to describe just how stunning this place is and how amazingly it has survived over centuries since it was built. It is only a few pounds for the entrance fee and you will not be disappointed. Definitely not one to miss...

Well worth a visit. This ancient place of learning with its fabulous courtyard and beautiful intricately carved archways provides endless photographic opportunities. Wander down the corridors with its multitude of tiny dorm rooms, some looking out onto the courtyard and imagine the countless men who came to learn here !!

Interesting!. Our Guide's Father studied here which made it extra special. It closed its doors in 1959 - scholars were only admitted if they were super bright and mesemerised the Koran. They then studied astronomy (linked to worhsip), theology, sciences and literature. A remarkable place worth a visit.

Beautiful Architecture. An old school that has some beautiful features. It is well worth going to see as the architecture of the building is really lovely. You can see the influence that North Africa had on Spain. The carvings on the stone work and the tiling are really amazing. I would really recommend a visit.

Fantastic History. Great place to go see. It does take a little bit of pain to get here but when your in it is a beautiful place to see. Was great to go, my son had a chance also to run around and was enjoying it. Great history to see and great feel when walking around the various rooms. Highly recommended if you want to see some history of Morocco
A Rainy day resort. We only visited it as it was on the guide's itinerary. The contemporary paintings on display made it worthwhile.

Oasis of place right in the middle of the hectic Medina. A must see place when in the medina of Marrakech. This former Koran School is a beautiful and peacefull place to visit. Make sure you have a good detailed medina map to find it. Once there you have seen it all in about 30 to 45 minutes, but it is worthwhile the visit and the 2 euro entrance fee.
Worth the visit. A nice mixture between wooden- and clay-structure. Decked with the characteristic mosaic. Visit both levels and climb in to and explore all the small rooms in 2nd floor.
Amazing. Very interesting and amzing to see. Well maintance. Our guide told us a lot about the building and the handwork.
Beautiful architecture. I have visited the Medersa when I was in Marrakech. The architecture is very impressive. It is beautiful and a classic to do in Marrakech.

Amazing, maze-like building. This building is a must see when visiting Marrakech. All the details never stop to amaze, everything is so well maintained. Entrance fee is only 10 DH. Only downside is that we didn't find any information about the different rooms in the building. Would have been nice to know what we were looking at.

Wonderful history. An old religious school/university. Full of little bedrooms and one really gets the feeling of how the scholars lived as they scurried through the corridors to emerge into the breathtakingly gorgeous courtyard. An absolute bargain. Also easy to get to and provides 30-40 mins of quiet away from the bustle of the souk.

interesting place. it worth a visit and the ticket is not expensive.maybe you will find a longue queu.
It's ideal for rainy day

Beautiful peice of history. This was a beautiful peice of history i'm glad i saw we didnt ask for a tour guide but managed to join a group who explained the building in a little more detail. Recommend a tour guide just to give that little bit of oomph history knowledge!Amazing to see the small rooms dedicated for study and how simpler a time it was back then and how many distraction we have now!

Beautifully Mesmorizing. If you're into Moroccan architecture and design then this place is definitely worth a visit. It is beautiful and fascinating to walk around with quirky rooms and passages. Plus its under £5 per person to visit so why wouldn't you!
Wonderful Madrasa. A nice place to visit if you like moroccan authentic design. It is one of the most elegant buildings in Marrakech.

History, architecture, social school life. The Madrassa BEN YOUSSEF is a wonderful place to make you travel back through the years.
It architecture shows how social life was organized within an institution. I invite you to make the trip by yourselves.
Architecture!. I've been to places, lot's of laces. But this place is just breathtaking. The architecture, the details - these are from another world. It's a MUST in Marrakesh!

Biggest Madrasa. After having lunch in Jema el Fnaa, we off to Ben Youssef Madrasa. Its took 20 mins from Jema el Fna and close at 5pm. Entry fee for DH20. Inside the Madrasa is very beautiful, its big and artistic.

Great little attraction. Great spot if you want to see a really nice piece of Islamic history. Not very big but can wander around for up to an hour if you want to take some good photos. Beautiful central area.
Beautiful. If you're after a beautiful Moroccan building, this is a really good one to see. The best-decorated building we visited in Marrakesh.
meh. Not sure why this is so highly rated. Its mostly a big empty room that's heavily worn. I can respect its cultural significance, but after 3 minutes here you've gotten the gist.
Worth the Visit and Conveniently Located. Ben Youssef Madrasa is worth the visit, and located a convenient stone's throw from Jemaa El Fna market.

What a maze of rooms. It is easy to imagine how this would have been like 100 years ago, in terms of content there isn't much to see but the building itself and some of the old photos of what it was like when in in use are fascinating.Internally it is a maze of small rooms that go on and on, in reality once you have visited one section the rest is just a repeat of what you have seen but it is the scale that impacts on you. I think though to get the most from this a guide would be useful as there isn't much to explain the function of the building

Do not miss this place. Beautiful place absolutely worth the visit. This old Coran school is full of mosaics, beautiful ceilings, intricate woodwork that would take your breath away. Probably my favorite place in Marrakesh.

A snapshot of culture. We visited the Ben Youssef as we had planned months in advance of our trip. We were not disappointed by just how cool the interior was. Guided tours were taking tourists round but this was not necessary in our opinion, great for the photo album and a peaceful experience.
Disappointing. Maybe you need a guide to truly appreciate it. The architecture is pretty but the rooms are empty and there is no explanation of anything
Amazing architectural detail. Worth visiting to admire the incredible design and architecture of this 14th century Islamic school. Tile work, wood and plaster details are amazing.
Amazing. I think this was my favorite place in Marrakech, beautiful carvings in the walls and in the wood ceilings.
Interesting. Not a lot to see, but a lot to read and learn in terms of the history and the architectural details. A visitor would get much more out of the experience if he had a local.guide

Interesting. A beautiful looking place which is a good sight to visit. You have to work out much of the history yourself as there isn't much in the way of information boards but looking around the Madrassa was a nice experience.
Stunning!. This is a beautiful place to visit. It has a very interesting history and is full of mosaics, beautiful ceilings, intricate woodwork, etc. A definite must see in Marrakech!

A must see!. Full of atmosphere and history, this place is a must see. Hard to describe the scale of the building, the beautiful wood carving and plaster work, or the eeriness of the dormitories where the students slept. The central courtyard takes my breath away every time. Don't miss it!!

For those who love architecture and design. There's a lot of history about this Madrasa - the largest in Africa I believe? But what attracted me was the intricate design of details in the Madrasa. Information only in Arabic and French. People interest in the history and Islamic culture should get a guide for visiting that place.

Grand!. This Madrasa (14th century) is an exquisite example in Moorish architecture - and said to be one of the finest in North Africa. The inner court is magnificent and its ornamental vaults impressive. 900 students could live and study here, and we visited some of their small rooms, which were more like prison cells I would say. For 20 dirham you got to spend some peaceful moments walking and contemplating how the students' lives must have been here.

Amazing!!!!. A beautiful, stunning building that left me speechless. Everyone who comes to Marrakech should take the time out to visit this attraction. At just 20dh entry, you should go, you will not be disappointed, and the walk through the Souk to get to it, is part if the fun.

Stunning.. The entrance is not so special, but once inside you will be awed by the exuberance of this old koran school. Beautiful decorations left, right and middle, and an interesting look into the life of students of the time.
Birght and sunny courtyard is the shining centre of it all.
Visit!
Fascinating. Endless pix of doors, windows. Fabulous insight into traditional Koranic school. Live guide or detailed book essential to understand how it functioned.
Worth a visit!. Beautiful building with intricately carved walls that you could spend hours looking at. Never been anywhere like it would definitely recommend!

unique. this Koranschool is a must have seen. The studentrooms are unique. Pitty they don't take the effort to evoque one room the scene of the studentroom. Now, all of them are empty and it's hard to imagine how it was

Great Artitecture!. A nice place to visit - has some stunning designs, and there is a lot of history in the building also. The toilets are also still quite original in style - which I found a weird surprise! ;)

a must see. this is one of the rare religious buildings you can visit in marrakech and this is a good reason to not miss it. you can find the little cellars of students and some other interesting old decoration. the final impression is that everywhere you are, staying too close to religion becomes always a kind of self isolation. maybe romantic and suggestives, but also a little sad. anyway a place to visit to think about...
Beautiful example of Moroccan archetecture. This 14th century building was a theological college, and had exquisitely carved and decorated floors, walls and ceilings.

Interesting artistically speaking. This old "école coranique" is very intesresting regarding to its architecture, and when you want to understand how the students were living in ancient times. The sculpted wood and the mosaic details are extremely beautiful.
Good to see. It was a bit repetitive but kind of a have-to-see place in Marrakech. It's only €2 and I would suggest spending 45 min here.
Islamic school for learning. beautiful architecture, fine details of design, art & colour, needs upgrading to maintain crumbling away.

An oasis in the souk. Reasonable entry fee for a beautifully designed and maintained building. A good refuge to sit and relax, away from the craziness that is Marrakech. It's a short and sweet visit, good for getting out of the sun and if you like architecture and design then most worthy of a looksee. Nothing totally amazing about the place, but it is serene.

Low entry cost so probably worth a visit. It was quite interesting but unfortunately the information was in arabic and french with no english translation. My wife probably enjoyed it more than me although for the price I am not complaining really.

Get a guide!. We really loved walking around this place and exploring the rooms but I wish we had known more about it while we were there. There is a very low charge for this site and I would loved to have paid more and been able to take a tour and have things explained in more detail.

Tranquil elegance.. Built in the 14th century, it has supremely intricate and exquisite cedar, marble, and stucco carvings. It has 130 student cells and may have housed as many as 900 students at one point! Climb up the stairwell to visit some of the classrooms. They are as tranquil as they are small. Some look out over the gorgeous courtyard so do not forget to take a peek. Facing the entrance is a prayer room that echoes one's voice throughout the school as you pray into a niche against the far wall.From top to bottom, this Mederssa is absolutely awe inspiring!And at 10 dirhams per person, it is a must do!
Hard to find on your own. Some lovely mosaics and carvings..but difficult to find without a guide. As taxis can't get near, you need to have a good map and good map-reading skills.

Beautiful Ali Ben Youssef Mederse. If you love architecture and mosaics walls/floors you need to visit the beautiful Ai Ben Youssef Mederse! Alongside that they also have a small gallery with gorgeous pictures and a small theathre, both worth the visit.

A Must Do in Beautiful Marrakech. Having loved Islamic architecture for years, the Coranic School was something I adored. The big, open vestibule, the colorful tiles, all of those little bedrooms for poor and less poor students with very nice perspective plays to be potographed were more than worthy the few dirhams requested to enter.

A Lovely, Tranquil Place that Oozes History and Elegance.. Although not as impressive this place reminded me of the tranquility of the Alhambra Palace in Spain. It's a lovely building very elegantly designed and constructed to create a peaceful place of learning in the heart of the Medina. In a hot climate this must have provided a lovely balanced environment in which to learn. It was well worth the entry fee and serves as a salutory reminder of the cycle of history and world influence, hopefully reminding current empire builders and those of recent centuries that the distribution of power and learning was rather different not that many centuries ago!

Interesting Historic Building. The Ben Youssef Madrasa - or Quranic school - is a cheap yet interesting tourist attraction in the heart of Old Marrakech. Not sure if it's possible be get a guide but would probably be useful as it is difficult to know the significance of the building without it.

Almost impossible to find. After almost an hour of walking around the medina and having asked a dozen people we eventually managed to find the Madrasa. The place itself is really nice, maybe not jaw-dropping nice, but worth a visit (if you manage to find it).

Best experience . This place is worth the visit to Marrakech of its the only thing you do. Get a guide. He's got some good yarns and it spruiks forth like a pre-recording. The tiles and rooms are well preserved and I loved the plaster work. The toilet might frighten a few people - it's unisex - and the tour goes there for a bit too.
Well worth it!. Beautiful place! I loved that we could walk all over the two floors and inspect the scholar bedrooms.
Beautiful. You must visit this beautiful and historical place. It has amazing eye capturing motifs and unique architecture.

One of the most beautiful places I've ever seen. This is a must see - it's significance in the culture of Morocco is worth the visit. A bit tricky to find if you are on your own but follow the signs and ask directions from the shopkeepers (not the guys on the street who will take you the wrong way and then ask for money).
Not to be missed.. One of the highlights, don't miss it. 10dirham entrance fee. If you want some good photos then go early to avoid the crowds.
Amazing!. Recently visited and this is a must see in Marrakech! The architecture is stunning and so intricate, great visit!
Beautiiful place. Such a beautiful place. The architecture is just amazing, it has such a calm, relaxing atmosphere. It was so beautiful we wanted to go back again

Efficient architectural discovery. I'm not really into architectural/arty stuff... hence, I really like this monument because it allows the visitor to see and admire a lot within a few minutes. It is truly breathtaking. Then one can just go ahead and get lost in the souk (which is the funnest thing to do in Marrakech in my opinion!). Very well worth the £ 1.50.

It helped having a guide explain . I would still go here even on my own but I was with a guide so I learned 10x what I would have learned. Go to the second floor to see the old "dorm" rooms to get an idea of how they housed up to 800 students. Look closely at the tile work and think about how long that takes to place exactly in the patterns. It was $2 to enter here.

Amazing and interesting building. In contrast to the Marrakech Museum, just round the corner, which in my view is boring, Ben Youssef Madrasa is well worth visiting. I am sure we would have enjoyed it even more if we had had a guide. Beautiful tiling and plaster work, and interesting to see the little cell like rooms where the students lived.

Wonderful architecture, great photo ops. This may appear unimpressive from the outside, but a lovely structure when you enter. The courtyard is great for taking pictures - go to the second floor and peek out the windows, and have someone take your picture from the other side. Our guide was helpful to us in understanding the history and logistics of this. Always good to have a great guide.
Not much to see . At 20Dh guess one can't complain .There is nothing much to see really that is after the architecture of the place .Took us less than 45 minutes to see the whole place .

Wonderful building, best attraction in Marrakech - must see. Gorgeous building with amazing ornaments, tiles and precious little details all around. Of all sights in Marrakech we liked this one the most.

Beautiful and historic surroundings. This is a fantastic place to walk around and explore. You can see where the students used to sleep and study. As you can expect, the surroundings are beautiful, with artistic doorways, carvings, and tile.
educational. we had a guide who explained to us that this koranic school was built by the almoravid who also built the alhambra in granada
fascinating building. well worth exploring - if you can find it. Not particularly well preserved but what is there is beautiful- amazing carvings
Inexpensive site, but not much to see. If you are staying in the Medina, its a nice change of pace to the hustle and bustle, but there is really only a couple of interesting aspects of the site.

Wonderful Islamic art. A simply stunning building that has a sense of calm and tranquility. The architecture is beautiful . It did however have the feel of neglect, a bit of investment and it could have been a more educational experience. The only signage was in French or Arabic and I left feeling I could have understood so much more about such an historically important building than our guide book gave us. Defiantly worth a visit and a small 20 DH entrance fee

Wouldn't have wanted to be a student here!. It's an interesting walk around the old Madrasa. I am sure there is lots of history and stories to tell. They could do more with the descriptions but if you agree a price with one of the many unofficial tour guides you will hear about the life in the Madrassa.

20 Dirhams well spent. The architecture of the Madrassa is beautiful and the history of the building is too with useful explanations provided on information boards throughout (if you can read French). It's interesting being able to walk around and see the students' rooms and the open courtyard with the carvings that adorn the walls provides the nexus for your wanderings. At 20 dirhams, you can't not visit.

very interesting. We visited this quran school with a guide called Abdul, arranged by the Villa Makassar; it was such an interesting visit. The rooms that the students stayed in were very small but the space was so beautiful.
Beautiful. This is a must see in Marrakech. It is not expensive and it is beautiful and big. Great for taking pictures

Beautiful carving. It may look a bit shady at the entrance but do not hesitate to step in as you will be in awe. I believe it is now only a tourist attraction as compared to the school it once was. The wood and stone work across the entire structure is amazing.

my favourite monument in Marrakech. This is really a special place. the best monument of the city. There are a lot of nice and typical decorations. A large court is surrounded by small rooms for students, in a perfect and harmonic geometry.

Beautiful Moroccan Architecture. This a beautiful place that has lots of gorgeous tile and architecture. It is definitely worth a visit and hiring a guide may enhance your visit if you want to learn more about the school (although I did not do this and still enjoyed it).

Amazing piece of history in the medina . The Ben Youssef should be rated as #1 place to visit in Marrakech! An amazing, beautiful place in the medina. A lot of history, I could easily spend 2 hours here. Great value for your money at only 20 MAD.

Beautiful. . Only 20 dhms entry per person (about £1.50 each) the building had amazing architecture from the quranic verses hand carved into the walls to the tiling of each individual tiny tile to create the beautiful moroccan wall and floor designs. To imagine something of this quality was made so many years ago. It would be better to have a guide inform you about the whole school and each detail, however seeing this architecture was beautiful enough especially at that price. Loads of photo opportunities. In my opinion, one of the best places to visit. Definitely ahead of the jardin majorelle.

Amazing craftsmanship. For a small entrance fee you will witness fantastic craftsmanship. It is such a beautiful building with lots of photo opportunities. It would have been better if there was more information about the place, I came across by accident. I found out more info from the internet than the actual visit, but still worth a visit

Interesting and Different. We only had about 45 minutes to explore the grounds, but I found it beautiful and interesting. I wish I would have had a 30 minute tour of the former Islamic College. I found this much more interesting than the Jardin Majorelle which was listed #1 of things to do in Marrakech. I would absolutely recommend Ben Youssef Madrasa over Jardin Majorelle.
A must-see. If you don't go here, you haven't been to Marrakesh. Striking beauty, sometimes in the smallest architectural details. Fun for kids as they imagine what school would have been like here.
Calm. Interesting to see where students learnt the Quaran and the only place where you can see anything resembling a mosque as the mosques in Marrakech are closed to non- Muslims
Just wow. An absolutely stunning piece of architecture in its own right - go in the afternoon for wonderful lighting for photographs. 20 DHM. Beautiful - my favourite place in Marrakech.
Stunning. This might be one of my favorite sites in Marrakech, a beautiful Koranic School where you are free to walk around and imagine the school back in the days
A must see!. Don't miss this if in Marrakesh.it is definitely worth a visit and easy to find. the entrance fee wasn't much,do go upstairs to see the dormitory area.

Thought provoking. This schoolhouse was once home to 900 young boys being educated in the Quran, which seems hard to believe given the size of the dormitories that fill the second floor of the building. It's best viewed in the afternoon when the sun lights up the courtyard for great photo opportunities. We spent about 45 minutes looking around the building and although were advised by our guidebook it's better to buy a combination ticket for both the schoolhouse AND the museum next door, were then told by the miserable guy at the ticket counter this wasn't possible.Although we didn't go to the museum, the rooftop terrace of their cafe looked very inviting.
Amazing Architecture. This madrassah is where people used to learn the Quran. It has amazing architecture filled with arabic calligraphy. It is a must see in Marrakesh!
Step back in time. An interesting structure. We hired a guide to take us round the Souk and he brought us to this museum and told us a bit about it.Worth the 20 Dihram entrance fee
Fascinating!. A great place to go to step out of the craziness of the souks. Like stepping back in history. People posing as guides inside but they do take no for an answer.
A must see!. A must see. So beautiful! Roam in the upper floor. Take a break from the hustle of the surrounding medina and souks.

Impressive and quite an education. The architecture, the mosaics, the intricate carving were all visually impressive, but we especially enjoyed our guide's explanations of its purpose as a religious school for boys. Boys with more influence were in the bigger dorm rooms with small windows while poorer ones were in tiny rooms without windows looking onto the courtyard. The guide also explained that pictures and sculpture were not allowed so the beautiful, intricately carved plaster work was decorative as well as delivering words of importance in Arabic.
interesting. Ben youssef madrasa is an interesting place for visiting.. you must visit there as a tradition place in Morocco !
Wonderful architecture. For a very modest entrance fee this gives the feel of a Madrassa. Beautiful carvings and tiling. Beware of the steep staircases.

Simply stunning!. If you like architecture, beautiful tiling, stucco and wood carving, this is a must. Very beautiful and very peaceful. A little haven of quiet and calm. Typical Moorish style . Interesting to see inside an ex seminary as today, non Muslims are not allowed in mosques or other related religious establishments . A must see
Breathtaking. Beautiful ceilings and walls all around, breathtaking views from room to room , clean washrooms , quiet and peaceful place to walk around and take great pictures.

Beautiful and interesting. Beautiful intricate carving and tiles everywhere, genuinely couldn't stop taking photographs which is unusual for me. The history of the school is also very interesting but if you don't read either French or Arabic read up on it before you go as the info isn't in English.

Raining? Let's Hide Out in Bed Youseff. Save your 20 Dirham and go walk around another part of town. The building is run-down. It's just a bunch of dark rooms and junk piled in them. Go to La Alhambra in Granada, Spain.
Impressive. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to the Ben Youssef Madrasa. The Courtyard is beautifully decorated - stunning.
Nice visit. Nice to visit and the Biennale being there are the same time was nice. Great architecture so definitely worth a stop.

So beautiful . This is a defiantly must see in Marrakech if you are interesting in Islamic architecture and ceramic decorations! And the ticket price is very cheap, worth to spend a sunny afternoon inside to take some pics !

Oh the level of detail. I found this to be the best of the attractions we visited while in the medina. Not too costly to get in and more than enough cool things to see while inside. At least if you appreciate tons of mosaic, nifty architecture and highly detailed decorations. Which I apparently do, cause I liked the place.

Very nice architecture. Verrry beautiful architecture! Entrance was 20 dirham i think. There is a library within the school and old pictures of how it used to be. You have to walk through the souks to get there. Download an offline map of Marrakech and you will easily find it.

Beautiful . You have to pay to get in, absolutely breathtaking work, and history be careful of ppl giving you stuff for 'free' then asking for a little bit of money?!?! Stay clear of the boys hanging outside waiting for tourists! But great place and a must see!

Wonderfully elaborate. Pretty much every surface in every common area (but not the cells for the pupils) is elaborately and tastefully decorated. I would have appreciated more captions explaining the cost

Beautiful and Interesting. This former school of Islamic studies is beautiful and interesting. Our tour guide gave us some great history. Take time to wander/explore. A small entrance fee is required.

It has to be the best historical place in Marrakesh. This place has to be must visit place in Marrakesh. It is really well preserved. Kudos for the management for putting old photos of the place when it was still used as madrasa. They help visitors to appreciate the place more by browsing through the photos.
to see. interesting madrasa and amazing architectural details. wander about for half an hour or so. definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful but difficult to find. A very beautiful place and buildings. Explanations in English were scarce however. Very impressive architecture and decoration

Mosaic delight. Once located amongst the small alleyways of the medina you enter to a beautiful mosaic pool area that in its day would have been beautiful. There are many stairs leading to rooms and turrets to explore with hidden windows and doors. Very popular so can get busy.

Not to be missed!. Wander around at will within this beautiful space and wonder about the boys who studied here. Spectacular architecture and tile work.
Prepare yourself by reading up about it before you go or take a guide book with you to read about it while there.

Intricate Art . Mederasa is all about intricate art. A must visit for any artist or architect. Place is also easy to find. You can easily spend an hour here admiring the artwork. Might be a good idea to visit with a guide.

Worth a visit. This Medersa is absolutely worth a visit. The entrance fee is very low (I think € 1 for adults and 30 c for kids) so that should not stop you from going. We did not have a guide so we are not quite sure what all the rooms were for etc., but the wonderful decoration was enough for us to enjoy the visit.
Very interesting . Well worth a visit. The building is unspoilt and very interesting. Quite tricky to find unless using navigation on phone.

Gorgeous. Really beautiful. It's interesting to walk through, I believe it was once a school and you can see where the students used to live. If you enjoy photography it's a fun place to get a few snaps. The tile work is stunning and the level of detail in the walls is very impressive. There is an entry fee and it doesn't take that long to see every thing but I would recommend making the effort to find this place and take a look inside.

Beautiful. Interesting.. Visited while out on a walk in Marrakech. When you enter you are straight away wowed. There are a few different rooms to look in with interesting things to see. Everything is so bright and well maintained.

Artists and Architects will love it!. A beautiful place, that won't take long and doesn't cost much to visit, around 2 euros a person. It is beautiful, take your time with taking pictures some really creative shots can happen there.
Madrasa. We visited this with a guide who explained so much it made it even more beautiful - I would highly recommend doing it this way.

Historically fascinating place while visiting the Medina. Interesting place, presently in a non renovated state. Here, teachers and students lived to learn the Koran until mid 20 century. Little explanation but you will find more data in many Travel guides or internet
Nice place, unfortunately empty of furnitures!. The palace is really nice, and the entrance is cheap! The spaces are big and truly moroccan decorated! worth to visit!
Worth it. Interesting architecture and detailing of what was once a school. Kind of busy. Good Moroccan photo op. Fun to walk through souks to find.
Must visit for Marrakesh. For Morocco trip , you must visit this place if you love culture and architecture.This was medrasa old times for holy book quran

A must see in Marrakesh. A city visit to Marrakesh means very much walking through the crowded souks and enjoying this lively atmosphere. Besides that there are some interesting indoor activities to do. Medusa Ben Youssef is definitely one of them. It is in the old town, very easy to reach. You enter a dark gate first and suddenly your eyes are blinded with the sunshine of the beautiful patio. This place was a Qur'an school for up to 900 students with a dormitory. You need 30-45minutes for this place. It costs for each adult 20DH(2€).

Worth a visit - if you can find it!. The 20dh entry fee seemed cheap considering that the upkeep of this place must cost a fair bit. The inner courtyard is covered in geometric patterns and in the ground floor rooms this extends to the ceilings. Nice way to spend an hour.
A Gem. Ben Youssef Madrasa was nice to experience. Definitely worth a visit. I believe my guide paid for our entry. Not sure I'd pay alot to see it but it was nice.
Stunning!. This is the perfect place to admire and be in awe of the craftsmanship of the Moroccans. You will see these elements repeated all over Morocco and even in Spain.

Simply loved it. The Moroccan architecture is simply amazing, I really wonder how people did to create such beautiful a place back in the time. I really recommend this place for people who love the Moroccan Architecture, it is one of the places that you need to visit when you come to Marrakesh at least once in a lifetime.
Interesting. Amazing islamic art. Well worth a visit. Very reasonable entry fee. The detail in the carvin and painting is amazing.

beautiful building inside, a real glimpse into the world of ancient Koranic scholars. beautiful tiling, introcate cedar carving, and an extraordinary inbsight into the life of Koranic scholars in the past, who came here from all over the country to study. Helpful, informative guides there if you want them!
Stunning example of Classical Morrocan architecture.. Extremely well restored madrasa (koranic school) with stunnning decor. The stucco detailing is absolutely awesome!

Amazing place. This building is a beautiful example of islamic art. Many many fine details to look at. Remember to go upstairs to get the best view of the courtyard and look at the tiny rooms the students used to live in.
Fascinating historial building. This is a fine historic madrassa and is well worth a visit. It includes some very good examples of Islamic architecture of the era.
Worth the cost of entry. You really only see a courtyard and a few dormitories but it's worth it to see the detail that has gone into every square inch of this place. It is breathtaking.

Worth to go there. You can see the place where students of medresa use to live and study. Iteresting place but I suggest to you to hire a guide who tell you more about the history so you can get more out of it.
Gorgeous architechture. So unbelievably gorgeous! Try to go first thing in the morning or later in the afternoon to beat the crowds. Take your time and explore the whole building.

Shut the door and imagine the student life.. A fascinating and beautiful building. Enter a student room, close the door and try to imagine the life he had studying there. Some beautiful details on the walls capture your eye. Even with many tourists there was a feeling of studious solitude.

For architecture lovers. Great architecture for how old the building actually is. Nice tour. If your the type of person who doesn't really like architecture then this is not for you as apart from that there's not much else to do here
History and craftsmenship. I certainly recommend to visit this historical riad for the splendor of the architecture and craftmenship.
No more than 10 minutes needed. Yes beautiful architecture and designs, but this is no different to other riads and buildings. Don't expect to spend hours here

A Building of two halves. Central courtyard nicely impressive, but surrounding rooms distinctly less so, but quaint nonetheless. For small entry price you won't want to complain. The fun is in the finding of it and there are some nice cafes close by free from the mania of Jamaa el Fna
Classical building. Worth a visit for the architecture and craftsmanship of the carvings and mosaics, Very interesting history to the building.

Absolute must in Marrakech. The Koranic school of Marrakech is an astonishing building, really well restored. Magnificent tiles and patios, and the possibility of seeing how students used to live. Don't leave Marrakech without visiting it!

Wonderful architecture!. Loved the colors and the ornate designs on display. Wished they had more translation in English. Walking through the rooms and the hallways brings you back to a different time making you imagine and think how life was back then.

See one you see 'em all. The location was hard to find without a guide and really the only thing to do was view the building. We do not recall any signage or information to provide information. On the upside, you won't spend much time there.

Ben Youssef. In defense of the Madrasa, we visited this on one of our final days in Morocco. It's detail and craftsmanship was amazing, but it was one of MANY Madrasa's we saw through out the country and unfortunately it's a little worse for wear.
Interesting easy to viait. Beautiful architecture. Easy to visit and inexpensive. Nice to get away from the hustle and nearly overwhelming sights and sounds of the markets. Recommend.
Good value. Worth doing with Marrakech Museum nearby. Just fine and fairly priced at MAD20. Interesting enough however largely empty. Worth seeing with the nearby Museum of Marrakech (MAD50).

Historic Moroccan architecture. This is a beautiful example of traditional Moroccan tile, plaster and carved wood artisan work. Step in for a look at the students rooms and main areas of the former school. Entry is only 20 dirham ($2) and this is a great place to visit for about an hour. There is a WC located just inside - bring a coin for the attendant.

Lovely historical building to visit. was a lovely place to visit away from the market area. Easy access, not to hard to find. The architecture and design is really great and worth the trip for a small place, it took us less than an hour to see all the art work and walk around

Let's not get carried away and let's be realistic. To put this place into context let's imagine it was in the UK.It would be managed by a council or national organisation who would have made it 20 times better. It is an impressive building for Marrakesh but against say the Tower of London it scores 1 out of 10 or far less. It's not as good as Ann Hatherway's cottage as a tourist attraction. So in British terms, great building but empty with little to do except to wander around the small dusty rooms. For Marrakech this is a top attraction so get the hint! Most Brits would spend no more than 20 mins inside.There is nothing to see outside, as most of these buildings are faceless on the outside. Outside plenty of conmen and kids using aggressive and passive aggressive tactics to lose you and demand money. Difficult to find and the top Museum next door isn't any better ! The local tourist board can't exist or should be fired! Don't visit without a guide as trying to visit on foot is a trial of stress. Stay in your hotel and enjoy your sun holiday rather than visit unless it's part of a guided tour of the market.Stress is not a good holiday experience and it's not honestly worth it.

Historic and good example of woodwork and stucco. Not so easy to find. Learnt to avoid the 'helpful non guides' that tell you direcrions. wonderful examples of the traditional handicrafts of woodwork and plasterwork. Lots of rooms to explore. Amazing value at 20 dirhams each. Peaceful, calm and beautiful to visit. This , the Bahia Palace and possibly the Majorelle gardens are the highlights to see
Interesting could do with tour guide. Ornate decorative woodwork, mosaic and structure makes this place worth while visiting. Inexpensive entry fee only needs 30-60 mins.
beautiful. it is definitely worth a visit and easy to find. the entrance fee wasn't much. the staff in the bathroom froces you to leave a "tip"
Great to see. Small but very nice building to spend half an hour in. Can get crowded hence better in early mornings or late afternoon . Easy to reach.
Fabulous experience...amazing carvings and detail. Really atmospheric. Don't miss this if in Marrakesh. Inexpensive entrance. Do go upstairs to see the dormitory area.
Amazing for art . Great display of art...most of it was for sale. Really enjoyed stopping here on our walking tour. Estimate an hour at most.

Amazing building . This building contains some of the most detailed craftsmanship you are likely to see anywhere. It is a beautiful building and with the different floors it can be seen from different perspectives.
Worth a visit. Worth a visit but for us a short visit was fine. Visually it was lovely but I didn't manage to find out much about it whilst I was there.

Beautiful design.. We were enchanted by the design and the ambience of the building. The craftsmanship was astonishing. But we did have to take care not to trip on broken tiles while admiring beautiful things above our heads.
Historic. So beautiful and tiles so amazing, people so very nice .a very interesting place full of history and it was cool here from the sun
Spectacular interior. Beautiful building, worth it if only for the best selfie or ussie you'll get in the country. Too many perfect backgrounds and architectural details to fully take in.

beautiful building and interesting history. This madrassa has gorgeous tile work and a very interesting history. There are also some gorgeous black and white photographs on display. Only 40dirhams to get entrance and well worth it.
Beautiful . Such a peaceful place, arcticture is so amazing... it is well kept . Definetly worth the visit. Stunningly beautiful.

Magnificent historical building. This Madrasa (old university) building is simply one of the best examples of it's time. Beautifully built with wood carvings, many small rooms, a grand courtyard, a praying area etc. After walking around the building I sat down and just soaked in the history.
Ben youssef madrasa. Did as part of a tour amazing architecture carvings and history not expensive to get in and well worth a look round

So inspiring !!! Typical Old School from Last Centuries. I ve been in this school and I talked to people there. This School dating from last centuries was built to share knowledge and teach children from allover the country. It includes dormitory for 900 student.You should visit rooms by yourself, they are about 3m by 3m with narrow stairs. I loved the place were you can stay a while and feel wisdom. It's true that I got already my PhD from my country las year, but one there, I felt like there is much more to learn... So inspiring.
Must visit!. Such a peaceful place! The Moorish/Berber architecture is stunning. Give yourself time to marvel at the marriage of Islamic Art & Architecure.

a must in Marrakesh. When you paid a 50 DIR for the Marrakesh museum, then it is a hundred times worth to pay the 20 DIR for this Medrasa. A stunning building in perfect harmony. Simply a must in Marrakesh.

Stunningly beautiful. Since the moskes in Marrakech a closed to non-muslim visitors, the Madrase is a really freat alternative. The fantastic wood cuttings and mosaic work is absolutely overwhelming, and absolutely worth a visit.
Beautiful . This is well worth a.vist . This was an old Quranic school built a good few hundred years ago. It has the Chambers of the students and beautiful calligraphy around the walls etc.
Beautiful part of history - don't miss this!. This is a well kept part of Marrakech history and you shouldn't miss it. It is well kept, lots to see and you can escape from the hustle outside.
Wonderful calm museum . Really enjoyed spending half an hour wandering in the late get airy roomsAn oasis after the bustle of the soukOld pottery and costumesGreat mosaics
Beautiful mosaic and stone work. Easy to find - interesting History and Art to explore and learn further about this city. A good contrast from the hassle of the shops in the surrounding area.
Amazing architecture. A bit difficult to find (walk along small alleys). Once you are inside....the carving, mozaic and architecture are amazing!
Excellent photography exhibition. Loved the space & excellent venue for exhibitions. The photographs were informative and beautiful. I'd go back for the exhibition but not for the cafe.

One of the Highlights of Marrakech!!. This place reminded me very much of Alhambra in Granada. Especially the courtyard which was pretty much identical to that of the Alhambra.Lots of little rooms to discover and lots of photo opportunities! Architecture is amazing and beautiful calligraphy on the walls. Absolutely amazing. For the price you pay to get in, it is a bargain. I was lucky enough to go at a time when there were not many people there, so there were plenty of excellent photographic opportunities. There are two floors for you to discover. The upstairs, which mostly consist of student dorms/rooms and you can pop you head out of a few 'windows' to see down into the courtyard.The ground floor has the amazing courtyard with a few more bigger rooms to discover, all with beautiful colours and calligraphy to be amazed by. One of the must-see sights in Marrakech! Don't miss it!
Great photo-ops. Only 20 Dhs to enter. Not much in the way of information about the school but a guide book is probably all you need. Beautiful place. We got some great photos.

Worth a visit if you're in the neighbourhood. The Ben Youssef Madrasa is situated a short walk from the chaos of the souks, just around the corner and is worth a visit if you're in the area. 20Dhs gains you entry to this beautiful area which has been lovingly restored and is highly recommended if you appreciate Moroccan architecture. Be prepared for tourists if you go at peak times and do have a wander upstairs. The place is actually quite small and apart from a good photo opportunity there is very little else to see/ do here. Still worth the visit.

Nice and interesting . It's been recommend by our Riad to visit the Medersa and it's been very very interesting. also the building is very impressive. time your visit to avoid huge amounts of tourists.
Busy tourist attraction but interesting. Amazing jewel in the heart of the city, lots to explore. Rooms empty, but pictures were on display when we went showing times past.

Spiritual delight . We had a breathtaking experience walking through the medersa : silence, beauty. Walls are covered up with poems praising education. Ibrahim found the best guide to comment this treasure of history yet let us time in to think and meditate.

Great visit to enjoy the architecture. We enjoyed our visit here. The building is beautiful with tons of handcarved details and colorful tiling. It was quite close to where we were staying, so it was on our must-see list. It shouldn't take you long to walk through maybe an hour if you're stopping to take pictures.
Lovely architecture. Its walking distance from the main square but impossible to find in all those alleys. Its worth the 20 dirhams to get in. Its great for taking photos but its not a huge place.

Interesting structure. This was an interesting structure which suggested that a Madrasa, in some ways, functions like a monastery. Difficult to be certain though as there was no guide book or information about how the building was used which would have really been appreciated.
the hogwarts of the islamic world. this was such an interesting place to visit. There were so many photo opportunities and unique architectural delights. Our 3 year old loved exploring all the rooms.

One of the most interesting of Marrakech's specific attractions - worth visiting. Visitors mainly enjoy Marrakech for its overall feel and atmosphere. It's a fascinating place to walk around but there are surprisingly few specific buildings worth heading for in their own right. The Ben Youssef Madrasa is an exception. It used to be a place of Islamic scholarship but is now, for just a few dirham, open for visitors of all faiths to investigate. In season it may get crowded as non-Muslims cannot enter most of the city's mosques. But if you are lucky to arrive when it's relatively quiet you will appreciate its warren of small rooms - each formerly occupied by students - and attractive central areas.

Fascinating and beautiful building.. A truly interesting and beautiful place. I imagine it could get very crowded in the height of the season, but it would still be worth it. Get one of the guides to show you round, they're not expensive, we didn't and felt we'd missed out.
Tiny bedrooms.. Very interesting. Can you believe 6-8 students shared each of those cells? What a beautiful place to study.

Interesting, beautiful but no info. Interesting and beautiful place, but no info anywhere. One can hire a guide to get to know more, but I would like to have some basic info on a poster. The rooms get a bit same-same after a while, not much to see. The rooms are empty, it could be a good idea to arrange them as they looked before, i.e. how were they furnished etc? A place with a lot of history and 20 dirhams for entry makes it worth it. The visit will take you less than an hour.
Pretty average. You pay 20 dirham each to get in, and it is basically an old college to study Koran. It has about 140 rooms (give or take) and has some really beautiful architecture.

Ancient school. The building is beautiful with beautiful mosaic patterns on the walls.It was fun going into the different rooms and imagining what life was like for the students of the school when it was first established.
Interesting but not too much to see. Interesting place. If you pass by go for a visit. Not very much to see. I wouldn't go there just for that again.
Very old building. Very old building and also great style of arcitect example . Poeple used be studying in there . Entrance is 25 drham. Good place to see but nothing special
Nice to see the history. Worth a visit but a guide took us there and explained it all, if he hadn't I think we wouldn't have learnt so much
Well worth a visit. So difficult to find with no sign posting, we very nearly gave up! But so glad that we didn't. Beautiful architecture and very interesting. Well worth a visit and very inexpensive

Fantastic architecture and peaceful. Well worth a visit. Can be difficult to find. Great architecture and low entry cost. We also found it acted well as a peaceful break from the very busy souks. Our riad host recommended it and I'm glad we visited.

Fantastic architecture. A must visit place due to the excellent architecture .The 20 dirham entrance fee is being used to restore it to its former glory .A good place to learn a little about religion here too.

must have been amazing in its day. I spent an hour or so wandering around this beautiful building, The architecture is quite amazing. It had to have been a masterpiece several hundred years ago in its prime.

Love Moroccan Architecture!. I love the architecture & disgn of this old school in the middle of the red city of Marrakesh and it's good to learn from our guide how the students leave and learn in this amazing school!

Simply Stunning. This was by far the most interesting part of our trip to Marrakech. Yes, it's hard to find (as is everything inside the Medina- seriously, take a compass or get a guide as maps aren't much help and stopping to look at one attracts the 'help' of locals who routinely request payment for their assistance). For a tiny entrance fee, the beauty of this historic school is a wonder to behold- magnificent, breath taking carving, tiling and plasterwork. Great for getting photos of stunning Islamic architecture at it's best. I's a fraction of the entrance fee of the nearby museum which isn't half as interesting.

stunningly beautiful. We visited here on a trip advisor recommendation and it was well worth the visit - the atmosphere of the place was amazing and very reasonably priced - hard to find but worth it in the end

a place of calm. This has some lovely features and gives a real insight into life of the students. It was a hot day but it was cool inside and if you don't have a good guide book there are guides get the price first!

Glorious architecture but needs some investment.. Amazing architecture, but saddening to see plaster falling off walls, poor lighting etc. If you can see past the dilapidation this is worth a visit, but takes a guide to help you find it in the more entertaining part of the souk.
Interesting, Especially If You Are Into Architecture. We went here with a guide on a tour. The architecture is gorgeous and it's amazing that so much of the original handwork is still intact.

a classic sight to see in Marrakech. Beautiful building for architecture lovers and history lovers alike. Peaceful and highly ornate school ground where you can see how the students learning the koran had lived. For a small fee you can get one of the old teachers to take you around and tell you some stories but just as well you can just take a wonder around and make up your own versions of the past.

Local Guide. A local guide brought us to this sight, which is good, as it would be hard to find on your own. It has an interesting history and the details in the architecture are very nice. The entrance fee is cheap. the building is empty though, with no furnishings of the era - just an empty shell.
Interesting. Very interesting building.Well preserved. It really worths a visit. Read about it before hand and be very wary of fake guides in the place.

Oasis of colour and silence. 5 minutes walk in the smelling souks near the big square and you will find this traditional school, with beautiful stone and wood carvings. I was impressed with the conditions in which students used to live. Entrance costs 20 dirhams.
Not bad value for money. This was quite a surprise. A sort of Islamic training college, the residential rooms were spartan but the courtyard was beautiful. Quite a contrast and well worth a visit.

Excellently preserved example of Moroccan architecture.. Nice to have a look around, good architecture and fantastic tiles. No information in English, so brush up on your French or Arabic if you want to know what you're looking at (same goes for pretty much all of the museums in Marrakech).

Fantastic insight. The Ben Youssef Madrasa has some fine examples of the carved stucco, and carved wood interior, to make the most of your visit and to understand more about the school it would be useful to read about it or as we did include it as part of a guided tour. Our guide was able to explain the history and how the students lived and studied here.

Good value attraction . An old school , takes about 30 minutes to go round , lots of little room and a lovely courtyard . Only costs a couple of pounds to get in , so a good value attraction in the heart of Marrakesh Medina
Surprisingly nice place. Enjoyed the time here even decided to go in accidently passing by. This well kept place is full of historical atmosphere.
Fantastic architecture/decoration. Bound to be crowded, but don't miss it - the decorative work in the courtyard is truly exceptional and very beautiful.

Worth a visit. Excellent historic school, amazing mosaic work and architecture.
It's a little difficult to find, follow the map you have and ask a local or other passing tourists and you won't be far off.
Good place to visit to see historical architecture and it's cheap to enter. Don't bother with a guide, you don't need one.
interesting. this school iss an interesting place in marrakech , historic place , much culture . a must to visit .
Worth a visit. Very interesting building but a shame they aren't restoring it. They need the National Trust there!!
Beautiful . Amazing architecture, carvings especially for us non Muslims that can't look inside the mosques, and a peaceful sanctuary from all the hustle and bustle

Interesting style . The madrasa place has a specific energy. When I was browsing around the small dark rooms with high ceilings I was impressed by the way of building it. The history is in every corner and every step.

Amazing and breathtakingly beautiful! . A must to visit and ridiculously only 20 cent to get in ??!! Stunning frescos and tiles with ornate balconies and hand carved wooden intricate mosaic ! Fantastic central square and equally tranquil study rooms off central courtyard , a must to visit !
historic place interesting. its a historic attraction , you will learn more about marrakech culture from this school . must to visit
Beautifully decorated. This old religious school is interesting because of the wonderful decorations on walls and ceilings.
Amazing plaster work and ambiance. Coming from australia to Marrakech was a real contrast-the old and the new-we loved the ambiance of this ancient place.

Nice spot to escape the medina huzzle. Fairly priced, offered shadow on a hot day. Nice to look at the moroccan architecture and mozaik art. A way to escape the surrounding medinas for a silent break.
Historical immersion. Beautiful historic site with incredible mosaics. Worth a visit every trip to Marrakech and centrally located by the souks.
Beautiful architecture. A very interesting building and still in very good order. Not enough information describing the various rooms.
Pretty. Pretty to wander round, cheap too. Guides available inside however guest are free to wander on their own.

Beautiful . This historical place is one of the must to visit when in Marrakech. The courtyard is breath taking. There are also more rooms upstairs and downstairs and it's interesting to see how the students used to live. It's a shame the descriptions are not in English but you can find a lot of information on Internet which helps.

Take a break from the hustle and bustle to visit this beautiful building.. After a bit of my 'dodgy' map reading we stumbled across the Ben Youssef Madrasa and paid the miserly fee (don't think it was even the equivalent of a pound!) to get in. I'm not really one for 'museums' but this is a truly lovely and tranquil building which is well worth a time out from the heat and Souk markets with a relaxing central courtyard.

Some wonderful stone carving. Like most places in the Old Town you have to keep your wits about you to find this Madrasa. Compared with other sites we visited this one was busy. An unprepossessing entrance opens, through magnificent doors into a central courtyard, Here should have been two pools of water. Perhaps due to the drought they are suffering at the moment, they were empty. However there was plenty other attractions for the eye. Very high quality stone and wood carving plus tiling decorated the walls all round the courtyard. At the far end another pair of magnificent doors lead to the Prayer Hall which is a beautiful pillared room with yet more carving and tiling to admire.You can get access to the upper level where students lived in very small rooms some without windows. Spartan comes to mind. The rooms were stark, the corridors dark and plain but the light wells were carved wood punctuating the upper spaces.There was no information so take your guide book if you want to know what you are looking at.

Best place in Marrakesh, it felt so special. Defined as a school to study the Coran, it has an amazing energy. Every spot is quite unique and you can just spend a the time here looking every detail and exploring rooms. It's very especial place to visit, don't miss it.

Really fascinating palce to visit. The building is just stunning and does not take long to visit. It is very reasonably priced and was very quiet when we visited in the late afternoon. Relaxing, calm atmosphere, stunning courtyard, fascinating little 'bedrooms' and beautiful tiling.

Beautiful school, but I would not want to be a student. This is truly beautiful. The details of architecture and decoration is amazing. The old koran school has now been closed for decades and is starting to become run down. Looking past that though, one can see and feel the winds of history seep through. But attend as a scholar there, after seeing the small cell-like rooms, I would rather not. Well worth a visit!

Beautiful and peaceful. Cost 20 dirhams each to enter. Beautiful and peaceful in the centre of the Medina. Great to wander around for about 30 minutes and then sit and have a bit of a rest in the main courtyard! Worth a visit.
Beautiful architecture . Stunning architecture - the intricate details of the wood carving and tile art is absolutely breathtaking.

Visited twice.. Wanted to visit the old school when I saw images at home. Probably the most ornate building in the city, close to the museum and Ben Youssef, can get busy visit morning and afternoon for different sun position very cheap entry.

Stunning!. This was my favourite of the sites we visited in Marrakech, a great mix of historic, scenic and simplistic. The building is stunning and although it only requires a fairly short visit, for the ease to get there from anywhere in the Medina an the sights you are rewarded with it is perfect.

Limited. . There's not much happening in Marrakech so this place is worth going to just to break up your day. There are some nicely decorated arches in the museum, but not much else happening imo. Also it cost 50dh pp as opposed to the 10 dh we paid at dar Si said. Not expensive still, but just a little meh for my liking.
A highlight of Marrakech. An excellent Madrassa - lots of interesting architecture, the best thing we saw in Marrakech all week.

Stunning. To make it a fantastic Marrakech experience get a tuk tuk from Jemaa el Fnaa square through the middle of the Souks to Ben Youssef. It puts you right among the action and colour, smell and culture of the markets and once you come out the other side you have the amazing architecture to adore as you wander around Ben Youssef. You wont regret it!
historic school. Ben Youssef Madrasa is a historic school in marrakech , we had explore many new things ,full knowledge

An islamic architecture gem. If you love islamic architecture then this is def the place to go.As a non muslim i am not allowed in a mosque so i miss out on a lot of islamic architecture but this has all the splendour and tourists can see it as the Madrasa is not in use any more.Recommend going upstairs to the bedroom windows as they give the best view over the central courtyard

A surprising find worth a quick visit. This was another beautiful example of Moorish architecture ( beautiful architectural finds abound here). However, you must see it with a local guide or else you won't have the historical and religious context to make the site really interesting. It takes about 20-30 minutes to walk through.

Symbol of Old Islamic Schools. Ben Youssef Madrasa is an Islamic School attached to a nearby mosque in Marrakesh, built in the heart of old medina. It is a symbol of most beautiful Moroccan art and architecture. It is named after the Almoravid Caliph, Ali ibn Yusuf (1106–1142) who expanded the city and domains of his caliphate. At one time it was the largest madrasa in all of Morocco. The 12th century Madrasa was reconstructed in 14th century by Merenid Sultan Aboul Hassan and again rebuilt under Saadian Dynasty in 1560s. Entry fee is 20 Dirham.

Nice for 20 mins. We walked here from Jemma al Fenna. A lively walk through the souls. It's next to the masjid. We pis approx 10-20D each to get in. The architecture is nice, that's about it. I went off to pray and came back later, the ladies were still walking around. Nice restaurants about 1 min walk away off a side alley where the locals eat. We ate for 25D (3 of us in total), a toriusty restaurant near the madrassa started at 40D pp!!!Lovely and friendly staff

Stunning intricate architecture. Situated towards the back of the Medina, about a ten minute walk from the main square, this is a real hidden gem. Stunning architecturally, with intricate carving, mosaic and woodwork. All the rooms are accessible and it is easy to imagine students living and studying here. Well worth the 20diram entry fee (about £1.40!). There are official guides who will take you round but we prefer to meander and take our time. One of the top attractions we visited

This was One Man's Home!. This Riad, that is containing a central courtyard, is really huge. Everything is splendid in design and creation. No detail is just average, everything is art. Imagining a craftsman, no, artisan, working on an element and making a mistake to begin again is mind boggling. The colors have held up remarkably well. Deep in the medina this visit was like leaving the city for the country just by walking through a door. Just fantastic to experience.

A must see. If you like architecture this is a must see. Intricate detail, beautiful to see. Easy to get to and a little cafe on site to grab a drink or two. It didn't take too long to walk around which is ideal when travelling with kids.
Gorgeous architecture . If you are an architecture enthusiast, you will be fascinated by this place!! Beautifully designed buildings and intricate details!

Feels like we're back in the old time!. My 10 years old son and I really enjoyed our tour at Ben Youssef Madrasa. You can walk through all the rooms inside the university. The building itself is so beautifully crafted. The minute you walk in, you feel like you've been transported into the old days. Highly recommend everyone to visit this historical place.
Intricate carvings. You can do this trip without a guide if you have a guide book. It was easy to find, and you can get a glimpse of life as it would have been when the medersa was in use.

A must visit in Marrakech. Feel the spiritual quietness, wholesome mental relaxation, deep sense of belonging to an era of great artistic exposition and feel some of the Islamic values despite being of different religious persuasion.

Beautiful. This is arguably the most visually impressive tourist site in Marrakech if you're interested in exploring the history of the city. Try to get here when there are few other tourists. It needs a bit of restoration work for sure, but it's a lovely place to visit and stroll around. You might encounter some locals outside who tell you it's 'closed for a festival' but don't believe them.
Amazing old architechture. I was stunned by the amazing architecture that is within the walls of this place. The pictures that I took will never do it justice.
Incredible! . Incredible place! Amazing carving and tiles. It's a lovely, calm place in the middle of the medina. A wonderful way to see some traditional architecture. Worth the visit!

Dilapidated beauty. The architecture, tiling and decoration of this very old building are spectacular and worth the visit. It would be great to have some explanation of the features and history available, but you can sort of figure it out for yourself. Beware of the touts who will accost you in the downstairs courtyard and try to get you to pay them for a garbled tour that you did not request.
Stunning. A beautiful building with some of the best architecture we saw in Marrakech. Well worth a visit!!!!!
Medrasa. Fascinating and lots of photo opportunities, used until really recently. Water in the pool would have been nice!
Interesting and peaceful. If you have a good guide this is historically very interesting. Do not need to spend long there. Ideal visit as part of a city tour.

An enchanting oasis. A beautiful building hidden in the north of the Souk but well worth findingMesmerisingA gem and a must findThis is a sanctuary from the chaos of the surrounding SoukIgnore the youths who try and misdirect you to the nearby tannery

Another gem in this gorgeous city!. Ben Youssef Madrasa is a must for anyone visiting Marrakech. Stef and I had so much fun at this derelict Islamic college. Unlike many places of interest around the world, BYM is very cheap to visit, and isn't crowded with people. We were able to walk around and take pictures without having other people in the shots. When you visit, go upstair on either side and have a look around. The dorms are exactly the same on both sides of the building, so theres no needs to walk around the whole site. There are some amazing doorways and zellige tilework can be admired throughout. Maximum time needed for a visit is 15-25 mins, although we were in awe of the place, so stayed much longer.
Amazing and Breathtaking architecture. This was one of the highlights of our Morocco trip. Stunning amount of detail in the architecture of this building. Great value for your money.

Hide and seek!. Compared with many of the Marrakech highlights the Madrasa is rather unique, in that it is atmospheric without the crowds. The buildings provide an insight into the dedication of scholarly study. Each small cell demonstrates the studious purpose of the past. There are guides, but being able to wander is good. The token entrance fee of DH10, is so cheap, in an era of financial hype.

Great chance to see the inside of a madrasah.. This madrasah (medrasa in Morocco as I recall) is a great chance to see Islamic architecture in both wood and stone. You can see how the students lived as they studied the Koran. The art work is pretty spectacular.
Excellent architecture. Not much to say. A cool place to see morrocan architecture. You can take nice picture from the upper floor and enjoy the alley.

Enjoyed. After a wild goose chase a restaurant owner kindly showed us the way.It was a lovely building with all the student rooms looking over the main peaceful square or internal squares.The buildings are very beautiful and covered in ornate wood and stone carvings.The children enjoyed looking out of all the windows and losing themselves in the maze.Worth a visit for an hour tops
historic school. in this attraction you will discover a great history of morocco , many things new u will now , worth a visit

Stunning building. The architecture is absolutely stunning, with ornate floors, walls and ceilings. For a feel of Morocco, it is definitely worth visiting. We didn't hire a guide, just wandered around with our own guide book. It is very close to Marrakech museum, so good to do both together.

Beware the Tannery People. Apparently there is a tannery nearby and many of the local merchants are in cahoots with them as they try very hard to hide his already difficult to find wonder. The entrance is not clearly marked and is often obscured by local people selling crap you don't want. Just be very aware of your surroundings. The entry is under an archway. Once you do find it, you'll be here exploring for a while. I really enjoyed this place and it's very close to a number of other wonderful stops.
Just amazing architecture. Beautiful architecture with loads of photo opportunity. Very reasonably priced and easy to find. Well worth a visit.

Best arhitecture in Marrakesh!. Was a little bit difficult to find it, even with a very good GPS, because is in the souk area. The entrance was 20 Dirhami/pers, as against the web the price is 1 euro/pers. Without guide you'll not understand it very much, but we had some information on my phone and we stick around a group with guide in english. Is the best arhitecture that you will find in Marrakesh and maybe in entire Morocco.
great place. this place is an amazing place in marrakech to know something about the culture of marrakech , we really had a great visit into this place

Really great way to capture Marrakesh.. Its a great visit for about an hour, it costs 20 Dirham per person.Its an old college. You don't expect that it will look inside, from whats outside. It has beautiful moroccan tiles, you walk in through a corridor, and take a right and you are in the main plaza with the pool. There is great for photos, and see a lot of beautiful hallways. On top you have a bunch of very unique corridors around the dorms.

Bit of a gem. Well worth visiting if you are interested in Islamic art and architecture. The students cells are interesting - they weren't permitted much in the way of distractions from their studies by the look of it! Try and get there early before the crowds (although the same applies to anywhere).Note that the Marrakech Museum is next door - don't miss that.
Stunning architecure !. This is a very beautiful place to visit (entry fee is only 20 MAD) and a paradise for photo amateur. It is also a great place to relax for a few minutes.

Abit difficult to find. his place is very difficult to find and getting directions from the locals is not always reliable. It should have taken us 15 minutes to get to the Madrasa from our riad, but we finally got there after about 2 hours with a slight detour via a tannery.
historic place. this school is a historic of marrakech , much exploering more information about marrakech schools , informative visit
Beautiful zellij art. The zellij tiles are mesmerising, I loved wandering around this first Islamic college in Marrakech. A must-see attraction.
Great place and beautiful architecture. One of marrakech's best attractions. Although the student bedrooms become fairly repetitive it is a great site to see some morrocan culture.

Worth a visit!. A lovely old building, full of intricate carvings and beautiful mosaics. A very small entrance fee. Nice to wander round at your own pace, escaping from the bustle of the souks for a while.

Stunning. Really beautiful architecture I loved taking pictures from the little student 'cells' it was 20 dirham to get in but do check your change , the guy in the ticket office short changed me (gave me 2 5's instead of 210's ) Unfortunately this seems to be in my experience common from some people here but others are extremely honest and helpful

so much intricate carving. So much intricate carving this place is amazing. The cell-like bedroom/dorms were interesting in that only the rooms on the inside had windows. After a while I realised that the carvings were of nothing and became mind numbing.

Recommended. As previously mentioned by others this is a place worth going to. As most of the Mosques don't permit non Muslims, it can be difficult to admire the architecture and craftsmanship of the historical buildings.

great architectural place to visit. find your way there through the souk and it will be worth it,....It is quite an architectural gem , with so much carving , coloured tiles wonderful patterns , and peace and tranquility after the madness outside ! more worth while than the actual museum nearby
Stunning architecture. This is definitely worth the visit - small entry free but the interiors and mosaic works and breathtaking!
Stunning Moroccan architecture. Highly recommend visiting - this is a unique opportunity to see a beautiful example of Moroccan architecture...

History of marrakesh. If you enjoy history,culture and architecture then this very informative, we would recommend this excursion. We went with our holiday rep and the guide was so friendly and informative
history of morocco. thi school was so history we heared alot about morocco from ben yousef madrasa , you must to visit it if you are in marrakech
Well worth the visit. The time & skill of the construction makes it worth the visit another gem in Marrakesh. Had to look a little to find it but the locals were helpful with directions

Amazing Building. This was an amazing place to see but not so easy to find. We went past it a couple of times as there is a small and unobtrusive entrance. But when we got inside it was truly amazing with all the little rooms. Must have been some place originally. Would thoroughly recommend

Beautiful architecture. Passing by this place I didn't realize the beauty it has inside. One of the most beautiful places in Marrakech. You can hire a guide at the entrance if you'd like to know more about it's history, but I decided to wander around by myself, exploring all the old student bedrooms, the wonderful architecture. A must see, totally worth the visit!
Very worth while . A must see, only 20 Dhs and a fascinating and beautiful building to explore. Well worth it and photos are allowed to be taken
Interesting and historical place... Very nice and historical architecture... good for 1-2 hours of excitement. .. and a good Place for some awesome Photographs....

Stunning architecture. The courtyard is quite magnificent with the mosaics and arches. If you are a keen photographer you will be spoilt with opportunities of light reflective shots with the sun casting shadows through the latticed shutters at the Windows. Amazing archways.

Lovely old building. Really beautiful old building perfect to wonder around and check out the various rooms and patterns. May be worth getting a guide but I personally loved just taking my time walking around. Also nice and cool inside.
