Beautiful must see !!. Loved this area of Marrakech lots of real history and beautiful archtecture and a beautiful Mosque right beside the Madrassa

Interesting History. Costs approximately 20 Dirhams to enter the tourist section and Madressah, however muslims are welcome to enter the main mosque during prayer times, like other mosques in marrakech offers tranquility and peace away from the hustle and bustle of the cobbled market streets.
Best in Marrakech. Totally awe inspiring, the detail and beauty of this building is still something I talk about! Only thing is I wish we got a tour, would definitely have been worth it.

Wonderful! Its a must. It is really beautiful and I think is a must in Marrakech!
We went in the morning and It was not very crowded. You can get great pictures!

beautiful building. If you enjoy all the mosaics of marrakech this is definitely a lovely place to go and check them out! Go in the early mornings to avoid big crowds and have nice lightening. Must do to experience some of the local history and traditions
Ben youssef. Excellent architecture.. . .good display of wood / tile / plaster work . Well worth a visit . .only 10 Dirham per person :-)

An absolute must see!. You cannot leave the Medina without seeing this beautiful building! The architecture is simply sublime. Taking pictures of the little dormitories is an idea, so you can show your children how lucky they are these days with university accommodation! The interior balconies are works of art and all the woodwork is beautifully carved. Definitely worth the visit!

Lovely building but not much information easily available. Very beautiful building which would have been more enjoyable if there was more information to help us appreciate the history of the place. Rather crowded. Selfie sticks galore.
Beautiful architecture and design. A fantastic example of Arabic architecture at its best, a must see especially for photographers. Beautiful tiles everywhere.

Must See. Our guide took us here. I think it would be better to see with a guide. Lotsof history to learn here. The guide will tell you about everything you see instead of just walking around and not knowing what anything is. It is a wonderful piece of Morrocan History.

I've been in Marrakech for 17 times now and I've never left the city without visiting this inspiring place.. Beautiful building, amazing decoration, extraordinary architecture.
I've seen the place in 1998, before the restauration and they did a great job to give the building a wonderful facelift.
I've been visiting this place several times between the year 2000 and the year 2015.
I've never been disappointed.

Must-see. Beautiful views inside. Can be a bit crowded in the summer, but this is a site you do not want to miss when in Marrakech. It can also be useful to have a tour guide to give you a little history about the place.

Its a must see when in Marrakech. The memory of this beautiful building is one that has stayed with me even though it was a few years ago now that we visited it. It and Bahia Palace were highlights on our city tour (and of course the markets)
Extraordinary!!. The Madrasa is a unique place in Marrakech. Only few persons enter at a time, so you can enjoy the Madrasa in private. It`s extraordinary!!
step back in time. Down a little side street you will find yourself stepping back in time. Wonderful decoration, the tiles and plaster work are worth the visit.

Well worth a visit but beware of overcharging. A beautiful historical place in the centre of the city. Went without a guide and just explored the building and It's quite big over 2 floors. If you want to know the detailed history, then I would recommend coming with a guide, or you can try and eavesdrop on other guides for free!An eye opener and historical; You get to see how the students used to live and study. There are many chambers, prayer-rooms and courtyards within. Apparently entry is 10dirhams however we were charged more than double that which isn't a lot of money by any stretch of the imagination but still, it's not right.
😍😍😍😍. Such a beautiful place, so fascinating and detailed. Recommend going with a guide to take you through and explain some of the history.

Awesome. The history of this place goes back to the 14th century. it's been done up since then - in the 16th century! The detailed & ornate carving of the wood , stone & plaster in incredible. You can wander round this large building uninterrupted - jus explore in wonderment. The history is interesting too. A must do in Marrakech.
A most spiritual venue. A real eye-opener and ancient site. Quite a large location with loads to see and photograph so make sure your camera has plenty of battery and memory.
beautiful architecture. depending on the tour guide this is a very interesting place. lots to learn about the history and plenty of rooms to explore. gorgeous architecture all explained by the guide.

Top Attraction in Marrakech. A must see in Marrakech, this is a beautiful example of Moroccan architecture. The main areas are fantastic. The ceramic details are breathtaking if you look closely at them. But the interesting areas are things like the student sleeping areas and the Hamas.
Beautiful . Ben Youssef is very beautiful old school building in Marrakech medina. It is really worthy to see. There is small entrance fee but it is worth to see.
Cheap attraction and very neat. Only 10 DH, about $1 and very neat architecture inside. Expect to spend less than an hour at this location.

Cheap and lovely. Extremely cheap to look around and some lovely things to see. It is great to see the cultural side of Marrakech. Some of the guards will give you a half French and half English tour which is worth it for a few dirham's at the end.
Impressive decorations. This school is the biggest left in Morocco and its decorations are quite impressive. Definetly worth a visit, it si not difficult to find in the Medina.

Very lovely place. The architecture was very great and you get a good overview about how it was to live and study at this school. And the best is its costs only 10 dh and you can make pictures in all the windows :)
Excellent place. was lost in the architecture of the building waooo damn good. i recommend everyone to visit it.. also the work on the tiles were just fab.
interesting. good example of historic architecture and interesting jumping off point for discussion of Muslim education
Madrasa. Intricate complex of courtyards, corridors, student rooms, all magnificently adorned with Islamic script and art.
Best place to see some old Arab culture. As all mosques in Marrakesh are closed to non-believers this is the best place to get a good view of outstanding Arab architecture.
Short visit whilst on a birthday holiday in Marrakech. Ben Youssef is a historical building that is worth a visit however it does require some more tender care with maintenance

The Best in Marrakech. Of all the places I visited in Marrakech I liked this the most. The decoration and architecture was worth seeing and photographing. Should I return to Marrakech I would certainly make a return visit but this time I would engage a guide. Although there was a lot to take in and see I feel there is much more to be appreciated and I'd only be able to do that with someone knowledgable,

Breathtaking site that is a must-see!. We arrived just as the Madrasa was closing however as there was still quite a large group wanting to look around, security were kind enough to let us in. It is a beautiful and breathtaking site, that should definitely be on the top of every sight-seeing list! Close to the souk and Jemaa el-Fnaa

Peaceful place in the middle of the Medina. Walking through the Medina and its Souks can be at times very crazy and overwhelming. Just talking a site door into the beautiful former koran school Ben Youssef Madrasa. Take a guide who can point you to all the amazing details of this old place with all its facets in history of Morocco.

Unique and Beautiful . Amazing architecture and beautiful to see. Probably would have been helpful to have a guide to explain everything we were looking at within the Madrasa and to better understand the history and each of the sections and rooms. Definitely a must see and great place for photos.

Amazing gardens in a wonderful palace. A lovely place to visit. Interesting architecture, and in particular the detailed mozaics in the building. The garden seemed to include almost every lovely fruit tree you might want!

beautiful place. Once you find this play by winding your way through the narrow alleys it feels good to step inside and feel the beauty and tranquility - and although you probably won't be the only visitor it's actually possible to walk around in peace and enjoy the amazing craftmanship that went into building the buildings.
Interesting place. Definitely worth a look roubd and for us browsers of culture/history took about an hour. 10 dirham per person i.e around 75 pence so good vfm.

Amazing place!. Great staff, very friendly and beautiful building.You can go there if you take a taxi and walk around 5 minutes inside the souk (market)It would be helpful more notice to arrive but if you ask to the people they always want to help you.

Interesting insight. Enjoyed visit here, was part of a small personal guided tour of the Medina and our guide Youssef was knowledgeable and bought to life the Madrassa. Nice break from the narrow streets of the Medna

Very interesting place. Worth visiting with a local qualified guide. The intricate plaster-work is amazing. The history of the madrasa is also very interesting. Make sure you go up to the first floor, to see the rooms the students used to live in.Quite a place!
Amazingly Ornate. Amazing tiles and beautifully ornate carvings. Cool old Koranic school that you can explore. A little spooky in places. Really impressive. Don't miss it!

An amazing cultural experience! . Beautiful place, well taken care of I recommend visiting with a local certified tour guide rather than on your own, there's so much history in this place that you cant put it in words definite a must go in Marrakech
Very interesting. Walk around and "get lost" and take great pictures. Go to the museum as well further down the street fantastic culture both places
Worth a stop. Worth a visit for the interesting architectural details alone. It's easy to get to and won't take long.

Amazing building with beautiful details everywhere!. This is an impressive building with beautiful details everywhere! The tiles, the marble and the cedar wood are all just beautiful! You just have to see this ancient moroccan handicraft with your own eyes! The entrence fee to this large Medersa is just 10 Dirhams and it is located in the centre of the medina! A must see when you are in Marrakech!

Beautiful architecture and rich history. One of the most impressive architecture we visited in Marrakech. Even though it clearly lacks maintenance (As many government-owned places do), the lay out, construction and decoration is breath taking. Gorgeous plaster work, immense mosaics, and wood carvings of the highest level. They all show excellent craftsmanship.A very pleasant surprise in the chaotic Medina.

Must visit aboslutely beautiful. Very beautiful place and a must visit when in Marrakech. The courtyard is splendid and can easily spend a very long time just admiring the beauty of it. The rooms on first floor were all the same and once you've seen a few you've seen them all.

Really worth a visit, perhaps with a guide for best experience. Originally Built as a boys school this stunning building is breathtaking, with bright intricate mosaics and complex plasterwork, marble carved oillars and wooden finials and framework, it's s real feast for the eyes. You can go upstairs to see the many smaller honeycombed rooms where the boys slept, all built in a pattern around a central open space that varied in size and decoration depending on the status of the boys. The most brilliant students having large rooms overlooking the central square and pool.There were only a coule of exhibits so unfortunately yet again we were left wondering just how these people lived, what their furniture, clothes, food, life was like was left unexplained. Despite this lack of detail the building itself is well worth a visit. Perhaps having a guide would benefit by filling in the gaps of information.

A must see in Marrakesh. Great place. A must see in the medina.Although a bit degraded, the magnificence of the patio and the immensity of the students dormitory cells are still impressive.A guide will be a plus in this place
Great and interesting building. Beautiful building and it's good to get an understanding of how a Madrasa works so it's worth getting a guide.

Quick call in on Ben Youssef worth the detour. Worth visiting as the architecture is interesting, doesn't take long. Frustratingly, like the other tourist sites there is not enough information available. It's near the souks so a nice break from the chaos.
Ok . Not very exciting really. Wouldn't go out if ky way to see it. It's cheap at 10d entry. Once inside there are 2 rooms of ceramic tiles and that's about it....
MUST SEE. This place was absolutely surreal and a must in Marrakesh.I remember it to be a very small fee to enter but definitely worth while.
Beautiful architecture . You really should pay a visit there on your trip to Marrakech, you'll be amazed by the architecture.
Worth an hour of your life!. Ancient learning building decorated in stunning wood and plaster carvings. Large central courtyard. Guides on hand or DIY. A great photo opportunity.

Interesting and very pretty courtyard. It's worth taking some time out to see this place if you are in the general area. However, there is not much point going out of your way to see it if you have seen any of the historic architecture in Fes, Rabat or Andalusia. This will look very familiar to you and there are a lot more things to see and do in town.
A must for culture. Gorgeous building with loads of history. Recommend you visit with a guide who can give you an insight into this history.

Besides its rich history, its a great place for great photography. Once the largest Koranic school in North Africa, it dates back to 14th century. I enjoy going here, not just for the history, but mainly because it is a wonderful place to take the camera. If you love photography, you will love the patterns, the colors and the geography this structure has to offer.
well worth a visit. A really stunning building full of amazing craftsmanship. It may not look much from the street but don't let this put you off.

Worth a quick stop. The history of the Madrasa is quite interesting and worth a stop if you're on a tour or with a guide. Personally, if I didn't have the history I would find this a bit boring but the architecture is quite beautiful and makes for some great photos.
intersting. An interesting example of Moorish architecture, it is worth the money to buy a joint ticket with the museum.

Lovely place!. Lovely place! Entrance fee only 1 Euro, and it's a nice place to rest from the medina for a while. dont expect anything too special, the big square in the middle is the best you'll get. would still recommend going there, nice mosaic and relaxed atmosphere. you don't need a guide for the place.

Loved It. I absolutely loved it here, beautiful, atmospheric building with stunning decoration. I made the mistake of visiting about midday and it was heaving with flocks of tourists brandishing phones on selfie sticks intent on finding the most ridiculous poses possible. All of which greatly detracted from experiencing this beautiful building at its best. I will return - next time early morning or later in the day. Take a guide book or read up before you go. There is no information or guides once you get there.Well worth a visit.

Fantastic. The guide we had hired took us here it was fab the walls were amazing with mosaics and the upper rooms (although I struggled to climb the stairs ) were fantastic. Although it was 10.00am it was not busy and crowded which was good.Well worth a visit.Thank you Mohammed

Something & Nothing. Quite an interesting building, but having visited, Sevilla, Cordoba and Granada to name a few, I much preferred the craftsmanship of the Moors in the many buildings I have visited in the aforementioned Spanish cities.

Beautiful architecture . The Ben Youssef Madrasa has beautiful architecture and a fascinating history. It's not expensive to visit (10dh) per person, but there is no explanation or guides on the walls- so worth bringing a guide book or hiring a guide
Must see!. Amazing place which is tucked away. Some amazing architecture! Worth doinf with a guide to help explain the history.

A masterpiece. Fantastic OLD school, must be seen to understand how they studied the Quran in a surrounding full of inspiration. Not only one of the finest but also one of the largest in the Magreb with the capacity up to 900 students. The dome decorated with exquisite stalactites within, can be seen from the street, the zellij tiles, the carvings on ceder wood, on top of the bronze door at the entrence........etc a must see

If you love architecture and art - it is a must.. I was astonished by the beauty of the architecture, the detailed carvings and the mosaics. The only thing i didn't like was that it looked a bit ran down upstairs and no information was displayed anywhere.
Worth a look.. Myself and my partner both wanted to look around the Ben Youssef Madrasa. We were not disappointed - it was beautiful and for 10 dirham you can't really complain. Beautiful building.
Beautiful place. Really stunning, spent a lovely couple of hours looking round admiring the plaster work and carvings.
stunning building. I enjoyed the intricate detail of design and decoration on almos every inch of this building. It made me yearn to be able to see the mosque interiors!

In the deep of art in the Islamic schools. Another wonder in Marrakech, The Islamic art of decoration is here in its highly expression. It is fascinating see the ancient marvellous wood's and stone inlays. They have decorated all the ambients: lounges, yards, corridors with those inlays, Is possible to visit the little rooms in which the students usued to live and study, as well to imagine how they could live there. It is like ours monasteries declinetd in Islamic way. Really impressive, is one of the unlosable place to visit in Marrakech, with Djemaa el Fna square, and the suk.

very spiritual place. the beautiful carvings and mosaics make this one of the best monuments to visit in Marrakech, I would say this is the most interesting and makes a good half day visit with the museum and cafe nextdoor.Just imagining the boys learning the koran in such tiny, crowded rooms with no natural light is very moving

Worth a visit. Quite a nice palace, if you head up the stairs you can get great views of the city. It isn't the prettiest palace I've seen, there's a lack of greenery and feels quite bare, but it is worth a visit.

School was never like this. You might need a guide to find it but I reckon this is the best attraction in Marrakech. Once again, tiles & carvings are incredible. Visit the toilets - they're really worth a visit
Beautiful. Beautifully decorated and a wonderful insight into how boys lived and learnt to recite the Quran. Some wonderful photo opportunitites.

Breathtaking . Amazing building with exquisite architecture. Well worth a visit. Peaceful place to see in the middle of the souks. Lots of wee hidey holes to find, one we found up a set of rickety old stairs leading to a wooden slatted roof covered in signatures from travellers. We of course added our mark. Wonderful pictures to be taken.

Fascinating architecture. This is/ was a school, not sure if it's currently in use as such and the story behind it is fascinating. The design and architecture is stunning. Visited as part of a tour and this is recommended as both tour guides we had were extremely knowledgeable and very well versed and well spoken
Incredible. Incredible and well worth the visit. Well located to the north of the souks and definitely to be included in any day exploring!

interesting but not spectacular. I went here during a trip to Marrakesh as part of a week of hiking in the Atlas mountains. Entrance fee is cheap. There is interesting architecture and interior design but I did not think it was really such a great sight. If you have been to other great examples of islamic architecture especially Granada and Sevilla then there is not much else to be gleaned here.
Intricate Walls. I understood Moroccan art more when I visited this building. The intricate carvings on the wall made me appreciate how symmetrical and detailed they are compared to other art forms.

Worth getting the map out and searching for.. Not a huge amount here except the building - but it is possible to get a feel of how the boys lived and the architecture is wonderful. A 'must' if you have a check list of things to see in Marrakech other than the shops.
A must see. Beautiful, quiet, amazing architecture. The tiles and ceilings and so ornate and make it a wonderful place to wander for an hour so.
Beautiful architecture throughout especially the wall carving. A good way to escape the hectic souk area for an hour. Stunning interior, lots of photo opportunities. Entrance ticket was only 10dh.
Nice building, well worth a visit. Beautiful cedar wood carving and ornate islamic decoration, very inexpensive to enter and worth a look.

A quick snapshot of beautiful architecture . My friends and I made a quick visit to Ben Youssef Masrasa to see the beautiful and ornate tiles and engravings inside. We didn't have time to do the tour as the place was about to close so we simply wondered around. It was a wonderful sight but you don't need too long here and I'm not sure I'd make a special trip for it. Perhaps i'd have a different opinion had we paid for the tour (50d pp).

Worth Stopping by if You're in the Area. The building is impressive enough and the entry price is low enough that it's worth stopping in if you're in the area. I wouldn't make a special trip to see it though. Nice carvings on the walls.
Magnifico/ beautifull. amazing place, arquitecture, a magnific place to visit, to seat and apreciated this diamant of marroco arquitecture

A Place to Learn Something. This is an interesting building both from an historic and architectural point of viewTo get the best from a visit I would strongly recommend going with a guide as very little information is available on site although even without a guide you will get the atmosphere of the place

Marvelous!!. We tooked a guide to explain us the monuments, and it was the best we did.
This place is full of history, full of architecture, full os magic.
I recommend you to visit it, and lost yourself in this place for at least one hour.

Magic. When you enter in the Madrasa you leave behind you all the frenzy of the Medina and you feel a sense of peace and contemplation.
Very beautiful building, with stunning wall decoration.
Definitely worth it.
Nice attraction.. Lovely building and an interesting story as to why it was built. There are very few places to see within the city that are not religious and this is one of them.

Wonderful . The ali ben youssef medersa was very interesting to see just one in the life very clean , it was an important coranik scool in the médina of Marrakech were we can learn a lot of thinks specily the coran and the arabik lenguech thanks a lot.
Interesting to see. Old college, good place to see although there were no english translations on any of the boards so most of the stuff we had to translate before going there. Recommend!
Obligated visit!. Beautiful place! Try to go early so there are not many people and you can enjoy! The entry is 10 Dirhams per person.

Beautiful workmanship. Visited as part of a guided tour. Our guide explained the background of the building and how male students would come from all parts of Morocco and other countries to study.Built around 1565 by the Saadian Sultan Moulay Abdellah, there are 130 small rooms which would house up to 900 boarding students.It was used until the 1960's. Students then moved to a new building.The workmanship around the main courtyard is fantastic. there is carved vertical panels, marble columns and tiles which were added at a later.There is an ablutions basin in the courtyard as well as a prayer hall.Really work seeing.

Worth the time for an interesting short visit. Low entry at only 10d. Interesting to see inside the teaching school. Main rooms have extensively decorated very high ceilings. Side corridors off these at ground and higher floor level led to dozens of student rooms. Not unlike many monasteries, worth the short visit.

Madrasa. The Madrasa is stunning but there is no explanations or the informations you can get at the place. Also, be careful when walking because the stairs have a bit of an incline and that some of the tiles are loosely glued into place so there is a risk of falling. Anyways it is very beautiful, with lots of details and rooms(which are empty). I recommend taking a guide or something to really get the full experience.
Worth it. Very nice building. Not on par with Sevilla in terms of conservation but the best you'll find in Marrakesh.

Filled with Moroccan Architecture. A rare mosque that actually opens its doors to westerners and female westerners at that! It is filled to the brim with Moroccan architecture, mosaic tiles and intricate detail! It is a real sight for any trip to this city and worth the trek through the windy sooks to get to too! Stroll though all the corridors, terraces and tiny rooms which allow for quiet contemplation.
One of the best attractions in Marrakech. The patio of this place is really great, but the rest is not that stunning. Still, it is one of the best attractions of Marrakech.

One of the true attractions of Marrakesh. Very well maintained historic complex, ideal for photography and history lessons; we spent almost two hours in there, just strolling and gazing and feeling 'away' from the buzzling Medina.

Historical!. A nice historical place. Very cheap to get in. Me and my wife went without a guide and just explored the building. It's quite big on 2 floors. If you want to know the detailed history, then I would recommend coming with a guide, or you can try and eavesdrop on other guides for free. ;) An eye opener and historical. You get to see how the students used to live and study. There are many chambers here, prayer rooms and courtyard. I would definitely recommend this historical site in Marrakech.
Great place to see. It's a place that explains its self so you don't really need a tour guide however one would give you a full history lesson.Defiantly recommend to all

It's a lovely mosque. It's a lovely mosque with some very intricate Arabic text carved into the walls around the court yard. Not the most exciting place to visit but then I'm not one for visiting historical sights.
Beautiful complex. It is a beautiful complex, and a lovely place to visit for a glimpse of culture. It doesn't take long to visit so worth adding in to any of your trips to the Medina.
Beatiful building. The old dormitory to the university, the architecture is stunning.We had a personal guide which made this very informative.Try not to miss this when in Marrakech.
Beautifully architecture.. Beautifully carved patterns which still looked so fresh. A beautiful quiet, cool retreat that takes you back in time.

Decent Experience. The Madrassa is very beautiful. You can go through relatively quickly, as there is nothing to read and no information posted. The architecture was interesting to look at. In order to get information you have to hire a guide, I believe. We didn't try this. Overall, it was better than visiting the palaces, but not exciting. Just watch out for all the people trying to mislead you on your way to the Madrassa. People will lie to you and tell you it's closed or lie and tell you you're going in the wrong direction. Don't listen to them and you will be fine.
Visit to Ben Youssef Madrasa. Easy to find in the souks of Marrakech. Not a lot to see, but history is interesting. Tip expected at end of tour.

Amazing history and insight into medieval learning. Fascinating insight into medieval Islamic learning. I visited with my five year old who enjoyed exploring the passages. Entry was a very modest 10 dirhams and we spent 45 minutes here. It was very difficult to find and we relied on help.

Impressive. Impressive architecture. A real gem in the heart of Marrakesh. We stumbled across it on a walk through the souks. Never expected to find it there. Downside was that there is no explanation to it unless you go with a guided tour

Beautiful and Intricate; Worth a Quick Visit.. This was the prettiest building we saw in Marrakech. Little in the way of historical detail given at the site (apart from some opportunistic tour guides), but it was nice to walk around and observe all the carvings and calligraphy, very well preserved, in wood. Definitely worth spending half an hour or so here.
Superb architecture. This is the only Madrasa in Marrakech open to non-Moslems. The architecture and carvings are superb.
must see. beautiful and worth visiting. we had an incredible experience viewing the amazing architecture and learning the history behind the establishment.

Absolutely stunning. Absolutely stunning place, a great example do Islamic artwork and architecture. Very beautiful and quite eery when exploring the students rooms. Very difficult to get too, we got thoroughly lost walking through the streets in the medina to find the madrasah.

Architectural dream. I have been to Spain and seen the Arab architecture there but I was not prepared for this little gem. Whilst the Alhambra blows you out of your chair, this literally takes your breath away because it is so subtle and restrained. A highlight of any tour and one of my top ten buildings in the world.

Incredible building...must see!. This is one of the most amazing buildings I have ever seen! It's so close to the northern end of the souks that is you make it that far it is definitely worth a look. Very cheap to get in as well at 10 MAD.

Fantastic. This school is a must see. The architecture and design are beautiful! I would recommend taking a cheap your from one of the men who pounce on you as soon as you walk in, we learnt alot from this tour and everything made much more sense. The school is a tranquil place and lovely host to twenty minutes of peace and quiet in the midst of the souks. The colours and mosaic designs are something to be seen!!

Fantastic. This school is a must see. The architecture and design are beautiful! I would recommend taking a cheap your from one of the men who pounce on you as soon as you walk in, we learnt alot from this tour and everything made much more sense. The school is a tranquil place and lovely host to twenty minutes of peace and quiet in the midst of the souks. The colours and mosaic designs are something to be seen!!
Really impressive.. Visited on a thomsons tour with a guide and was really impressive the woodwork and attention to detail of the mosaics was great, not much to say better to see it yoursel.

Architecture masterpiece. A 14th century college where students lived and studied science and coranic studies, the architecture is handcrafted with symetrical mosaics in the sidewalls of the courtyard and plaster in which coranic verses are written in ottoman writing style around the pilars and in the top the courtyard. The design of this 14th century learning center is well refleted in the way that allows sun light and air flow in rooms and classes. However, I believe that most parts need to be cleaned and restored.

must see. beautiful koran school.. a must see for anybody interested in architecture and culture. a guided tour would probably make sense in here but if you are just looking to be inspired and admire this beutiful space then go here anytime you need some time away from the busy souks. entry is very cheap.
Beautiful . We visited with a tour guide so learnt a lot about the history of the building. It is definitely worth a visit.
Beautiful!. Exquisite architecture! Small building but definitely worth a visit! We enjoyed every seconds in it. You will also have great oppotunities for pictures.
Little bit dull. It was nice to walk around and the architecture etc is interesting but it's not super exciting as a whole. That said, for 10 dh you can't go wrong really.
impressive building. a impressive place of learning with some very nice mosaics and some very small rooms which students stayed in and a big bath in the centre of the building
Food for the eyes.. What an amazing building which is being beautifully preserved and restored. A photographers dream!!!

The History Of This School Is An Eye Opener. The history of this place is remarkable, it is also an eye openner. Take a qualified guide and a good one will really educate. I had no idea that in the past, Islamic students here, were taught all religions along with, astonomy, astrology, mathmatics, geography and philosophy. This was over a hundred years ago.

Impressive building. This building was previously a boarding school with impressive decor. Not much to see other than the empty bath and a maze of empty rooms. 10dhm per person for access.
Not sure if it was worth it

Nice and small place. Small place, but really lovely! Entrance fee only 10dh, and its a nice place to rest from the medina for a while. dont expect anything too special, the big square in the middle is the best youll get. would still recommend going there, nice mosaic and relaxed athmosphere. you dont need a guide for the place.

Nice mosiacs, lots of nothing. This building is worth a try because of the entrance fee of 10 Dirham. Actually what you see inside is a lot of mosiaics, wood, plaster and empty rooms. The fountain in the patio was empty when we visited. A filled fountain might have given the building a bit more atmosphere.

Not to be missed.. Beautiful. Hand crafted walls ornaments beautiful doors and get a glimpse of what it used to be like to go to school during its glory days. Take you time and roam around and enjoys the details of its architecture and deco.
Beautiful. I went here as apart of my day tour in Marrakech, It was so lovely to walk around. The tiles are so lovely and colourful.

Interesting but didn't take long. Fantastic architecture and an interesting part of the city's past and culture but one which was short lived and once seen wouldnt have me coming back for more.
Reasonable price to wander round at your own pace and definitely worth a visit whilst you are in town.

Marrakech's best ancient architecture . We went without knowing what to expect and its beauty got us by surprise. The building has suffered some damages along the years but the essence remains untouched: amazing arabic decorations fill walls and ceilings showing the opulence of better years, the student's area gives the visitor an idea about how life used to be inside the corridors and rooms. A beautiful piece of architecture, witness of Marrakech's history.
must do. we took a half daytrip frm morocco-plans it was just very nice the architecture is amazing a must do in this beautifull city

Interesting, But not a lot going on. We stopped at the Ben Youssef Madrasa as part of our city tour and it is beautiful building with classic architecture and it is incredible seeing the level of detail in some of the carvings and inscriptions. However, ultimately it is just an empty building, if history is not your thing you should probably give it a miss. Kids got bored quite quickly.
Madrasa is worthwhile to go. Worthwhile to good! different and well preserved. Do not forget to but the tickets at the entrance and to take pictures at the little windows
see the history. Interesting to see carvings and another way of life. We went on the discover marakesh full day trip. Excellent way to see loads of history in one one.
The Highlights of Marrakech. One of the most beautiful historical monuments in Marrakech. Ben Youssef Medrassa represents the history , the skills and the knowledge of Moroccan craftsmen.

Not expecting, great place!. I was really not expecting this place to be this huge and beautiful. The architecture and the details are amazing, and you will have 130 students rooms to get lost in! Also, avoid the "guides" that will ask you if you want a tour. Not needed :)

Nice visit. Only 10 dirham to enter but don't get a guide, you can explore both the ground and upper floor yourself. The stairs are quite dark so use the torch on your iPhone. It's quite tricky to find so be wary of locals sending you in the wrong direction or asking for money to direct you.

Wonderful Islamic architecture for 10Dh!. What a wonderful location. Every corner of this building is elegant and stylish. In particular the central courtyard is stunning. There is no guide or explanations (although perhaps was one in French available) but for less than the price of a newspaper back home, it was amazing. Highly recommended.
Beautiful. Beautiful place to visit with amazing ceilings, walls and floors. A must if you are seeing the sights of marrakech.

Incredible piece of story. This school is probably the best building I saw in Morocco till now. It's incredible the richness of details and the beautiness of art crafts made in cedar wood and the gypsum capitels / decors. The plan of this school is incredible and the laborious section allow you to discover incredible different atmospheres and rooms.Take more then one hour to enjoy the visit and do it alone to increase the personal sense of spaces.Absolutely recommended for architecture fans.

It's a building, big deal. This was meant to be a wonderful experience, but actually is quite underwhelming in reality. It's a big empty building, built around the usual central courtyard, with lots of really depressing tiny cells upstairs, used by the Madrassa students when it was a functioning religious college. There was no water in the pool in the centre, and the whole building just had an air of abandonment about it. I'd say go if you need to tick off all the Marrakesh sights, otherwise don't bother.

Beautiful architecture and an easy stop. Very cool to see - a beautiful interior. You don't need a lot of time here - maybe 30 minutes tops - there is not a ton to see, but the architecture is beautiful and it is an easy walk from the souks where you are likely to want to spend some time.
Very interesting . The place has a lot of history. I enjoyed seeing everything. Lovely to get lost in. The doors are really beautiful. The entrance fee is low.

Exquisite. This is a stunning piece of architectural design which at 10dhr entrance must not be missed! Beautiful, entrancing spaces which vary from serenely simple to inordinately complex in decoration, this is a real gem.

Loads of history. This is a very interesting slice of history you can see where the students slept and sought sanctuary. There is typical Moorish architecture and its pleasant and cool away from the heat of the day.

You will not be disappointed. I highly recommend the Ben Youssef Madrasa in Marrakech, Morocco. The architecture is very well done, the ceilings are stunning with different shapes of woods and beautiful painting.

Worth the visit. Surprised it was a bit run down, but the tiles and woodwork are beautiful and it is definately worth the visit. Not sure why it wasn't been restored especially as you have to pay to get in?

Another wonderful respite . Soak up the history and enjoy the peace wandering round. We had a personal guided tour that brought the place to life for us costing little more than the entry price and was well worth wile.
Great trip.. A lovely bit of peace in a busy city. It is hard to find. Seriously, really hard. You won't be there all day either, we were there about an hour, though it took us several to find it.
It is not a must see place. Don't expect to much, it is a regular place to visit, in 20 minutes you have done and see everything. Have to pay to visit...

Thought-provoking history. A tranquil area which had a lot of history as a madrasa, without the extremism provoked by that word today! Some of the signage could have been improved - at times we felt lost - but the courtyards and art were stunning.

great site. very interesting site witnesses the anciant archetecture of the berber in morocco :our guide explained the role of this coranic school in the past . he demonstated to us how people abolish before going to pray . the medrassa is a school and mosque at the same time . it contains a beautiful carving of the walls , we actually recommend a visit to this great place .

Ben Youssef Madrasa.. Boring, It was a very hot day and this was about the fourth venue on our itinerary. Our driver insisted we visit here. there are lots of Mosaic tiles but you can get that at Tiles R Us. Not a great hit with us im afraid,.

Beautiful architecture. This place is so worth a visit. The architecture inside is stunning. Such intricate carvings. We had a guy come up to us whilst inside and offered to be a guide for 50 dirhams. Although his English wasn't particularly good he was so friendly and we managed to get some interesting facts that we wouldn't have known. My 18 year old son also enjoyed it too.

Huge beautiful piece of art. I love the art and architecture here. It reflects a lot of great thought and craftsmanship. Details of mosaic and each arches are just gorgeous. The entrance fee is reasonable. Great for pictures.
A hidden gem. This ancient religious school hides behind a very plain exterior . There is a small entrance fee but well worth a visit to see the fantastic detail on the interior walls

Exquisite workmanship. As you travel around Morocco you will encounter many example of Moroccan arcitecture, decoration etcBut you will probably not see it done to the level of craftmanship that is displayed here.Well worth a visit.
Very nice!. For only 10 dirham it is a nice visit. It's not too big, but admiring the architecture and colorful walls, I think we almost spend 1h 30 min walking around.

Impressive Architecture. We didn't have a tour guide unfortunately so perhaps did not appreciate all of the history in this building as much as we could have, however its a stunning place with very impressive architecture and fun to explore.
okay. The building is architecturally interesting and we were aware of the history; there was no written information available and no guides to help us so it was just okay

Beautiful architecture . It only costs 10dh (approx 70p) to get in and the architecture is stunning- tons of beautiful tile arrangements, engravings etc. If you ask nicely the staff will take pictures of you! (And, unusually, not try and demand money off you afterwards)
Beautiful.....stunning.... Really interesting visit nake sure your camera is fully charged...a great museum next door and a little cafe close buy
Must see. This Koran school us a must see for everyone visiting marrakech. Beautiful architecture and well preserved. Enjoyed it a lot.

Stunning Architecture. This stunning building set in the hustle and bustle of the medina is amazing.Once inside this tranquil oasis you can only marvel at the stunning architecture and workmanship that has gone into its construction.The central courtyard offers numerous 'photo opportunities' and it is simply a place to take a break from the chaotic world just outside its front doors.Well worth a visit and do not forget your camera.

An interesting visit. Marrakech is a city especially to feel (especially the fantastic Jamaa el Fna), with few points of architectural interest. This building is worth a visit, not being spectacular as the palace of Alhambra (Granada, Spain), with a different function, it is a nice place to visit.Tip: If you are not accompanied with a tour guide, is natural to lose in the souks tangle or surrounding streets and you may have to give a tip to someone to help you to find the location. Anywhere in the medina you should have as geografic reference point the Jemaa el Fna Square or the Koutobia minaret.

Impressing Architecture and History. This madrasa owns impressing calligraphic on its walls and has labyrinth like rooms which were home for scholars and students in medieval era. I appreciate to visit it. I think this madrasa is the second most important and charming attraction in Marrakech (of course the first one is Jma El-Fna). You should pay only 10 Dirham to visit it.

Amazing Architecture. At the first instance we tried finding our way to the Madrasa through the souk using a map and we were quite unsuccessful. The next time our taxi driver found a youth who could take us to the madrasa. The driver didn't know the way he claimed!! Anyhow we agreed to give the youth MAD 30 and he took us through a maze and eventually got us to the Madrasa. At MAD10 it is excellent value for money. The architecture is stunning. On our exit from the Madrasa the youth was waiting for us and this time I told him to take us straight to the taxi and no maze! Which he did! When we offered him the MAD 30 he wanted more of course which we declined and there was a kerfuffle between another man and the taxi driver but eventually we left! It was worth the effort in the blazing sun in July!!

Worth a visit. This formed a part of our days we excursion, nice place to go to feel abit of the culture, I think the tour guides make this place as there is no explanation to any thing unless you guide tells you.

Beautiful building...don't let yourself get scammed outside!. Lovely, beautiful building. Just be aware, young men will try and stop you and take you to the tanneries, by telling you the building is closed. We were warned about this by our Riad owner, and true to form, someone tried it on.. Just want tourists to be aware. Don't let that put you off though, a firm non merci is all you need. The building is stunning, and well worth the very cheap 10d entry fee.

The Koranic school is beautiful and worth a visit - but BEWARE of the tanneries scam!. The Koranic school is a beautiful building and a photographers dream if you like Moroccan tiles and architecture. The entrance fee of 10 dirham is very reasonable too. But BEWARE! Youths stop you when you close by and tell you that the place is closed and you should visit the tanneries. They will then take you on a long walk through narrow winding streets so you end up completely disorientated. You arrive at this stinking place full of rancid dead animal skins drying in the sun. After 5 mins we said we didn't want to see any more and they tried to charge us 100 dirham!! We refused, were subjected to abuse and threats to follow us back to our hotel (I told him he could follow us onto our plane if he liked, I was NOT going to pay)!!When we did eventually make it back to the Koranic school, it was absolutely beautiful. It is open daily from 9am - 5pm so do not fall for the scam, and don't trust anyone!

Exquistie craftmaship in a religious place. Beautiful architecture that captures the essence of the time this place when this place was occupied. Exquistie craftmaship. Its quite moving to think scolars and prophets would have visited to teach and pray. A must see place
The mos beautyful Madrasa. One of the most amazing Madrasas in Morocco, well preserved, but could be very crowded. You can enter to almost every corner of the building, see the little rooms.

Pretty garden, but somewhat boring for me. The garden area is pretty, and the walls have beautiful intricate designs. However there are no lifts and the stairs are a little steep leading to small rooms which students used to stay in. There isn't really much to look at past the pretty garden. The entrance fee is quite cheap though - 10 dirhams per person.
Beautiful Building. Lovely place to visit, beautiful old madrassa with rich history. Great for photos. Kids loved it too, running around in all the rooms. A little adventure :-)
Great history. What a building. It was lovely to walk around at our own pace. Not much there to really see except the amazing architecture and decoration. Suggest taking a guide book

This place is astonishing. I really wouldn't bother visiting the museum next door. Ben Youssef Madrasa outshines it completely.
The place is so intricately carved it is gobbsmacking!!
so peaceful and calm.
It completely transports you back over 1000 years.
Interesting and Beautiful. Quite interesting to hear the history of this place and oh so beautiful! The entrance fee of 10 MAD is quite reasonable as well.
Lovely preserved building . Really peaceful beautiful old building. Loved the tiles and plasterwork and the Islamic patterns and designs. Highly recommended.

Beautiful Place!!. Beautiful, it worth the visit, and it is very cheap! You can see a lot of the Moroccan architecture, but I missed some explanations around the place, with out a guide it impossible to understand.

Oldest mosque in Marrakech. Oldest mosque in Marrakech, well maintained, beautiful architecture. You can see where students would stay. Entrance fee is 10 Dirhams. You can purchase both tickets for the Museum de Marrakech that is nearby too.
Stunning architecture, an hour well spent! . A beautiful place that one must visit. Take a guide in order to understand the history behind the madrasa and the architecture better.

Beautiful religious architecture in typical marrakshi style. This is different to the religious seminaries in the north like the attarine in fes or the bouanania madrasas in fes and meknes, there is still beautiful attention to detail and woodwork, but the style is quite different. There is more stonemasonry with beautiful intricate calligraphy in the red stones and in the red mud-brick building material. The rooms of the students give an insight of what it must have been like to study here, sharing cramped rooms with other students around the beautiful courtyard. Definitely worth visiting, unique compared to northern moroccan religious architecture.
Interesting place full off history.. A very interesting place with great history. Tricky to find though. I can't understand why things aren't better signposted in Marrakesh.

Beautiful but try to get there early morning before large groups. Can be a bit difficult to find, and aim to avoid the 'helpful' guides who with either want to take you to the tannery or charge you. If you need directions or get lost try the shop keepers.
The architecture is lovely, reminds me a bit of the Alhambra, but not as opulent.

Well worth a visit!. Myself and my fiancée visited here after a journey through the souks and found it very peaceful indeed. The arcitecture is magnificent and rather colourful. Another redeeming feature is how cool (temperature) it is.
As such I would recommend visiting here during mid day when the sun is at its hottest.
Admission is inexpensive.

Beautiful architecture and calming influence. Relatively easy to locate on our map of Marrakesh, this madrasa is a beautiful example of Moroccan architecture. The details and engraving are exquisite and service to enhance the calming and thoughtful nature of this beautiful building.A must see highlight.

interesting site. another place in the medina to explore . a very interesting site to see the encient archetecture of the 11th century . it is better to be with a guide to have a back groud about it and other places .
good landmark. cool place to see if you like historical stuff. we had a tour guide who took us here and was worth seeing.

Impressive. If you don't have a guide, be mindful that this place is very difficult to find and getting directions from the locals is not always reliable. It should have taken us 15 minutes to get to the Madrasa from our riad, but we finally got there after about 2 hours with a slight detour via a tannery. In any case, once you make your way through the vendors and the hassle at the door, you step into and architectural wonderland. The mosaics and the carvings are simply superb. The pupils' quarters upstairs are also worth a visit.
Nice visit. This is a good chance to visit a Madrasa.The entrance is not expensive (10mad) and it is near the souk.Building is under restoration.

Beautiful and calm. It's a beautiful and calm location in the middle of the very busy, hot and sometimes overwhelming souqs. The building is absolutely beautiful, and makes for a great 45 min or so break in the day. Definitly worth the 10 dihram entrance fee.
Good architecture. Very interesting to see a place with this history, and lots of beautiful architectural features to enjoy.
A piece of history. At 10 dirhams you can't go wrong with this place to visit. Nice and serene with great mosaic walls this place is great for photos.
Very beautiful building. You must visit this site when in Marrakech. It's very well preserved and beautifully decorated. You can visit the small rooms where the students used to live.
A must see in Marrakech. If you like to see beautiful architecture then you must see this place. So stunning, with such intricate, ornate detail and a fascinating history too.

A late medieval moslim university, preserved in it's original state. This is a very old late medieval religious school. We visited the place with a local French speaking guide. In a professional way he brought us to all old places in Marrakech and even through the bazar. The fine stone carving of the Madrasa is worth seeing.
Wonderful historic place!. Just amazing and the ticket is so cheap, 10 dirhams only! You'll take lots of wonderful pictures that make you feel you are in Andalusia.

Peaceful sanctuary!. Loved our visit here today. Highlight of my holiday. So beautiful and peaceful. The mosaic walls are stunning. Be aware of "tour guides" standing near ticket office. A guy there started following us around and although we said we would like to go around alone, he was very pushy and quite intimidating. We did manage to get rid of him and would defo not let this stop you from going to see this amazing place. Just beware.We paid 10drhm pp. It is on too floors. Going upstairs beware, steps are old. We all tripped up as uneven!To get to Madrassa, walk all the way through the souk to end. That's if you start from Djemaa le Fnaa side. If lost ask elderly shop keepers as the younger ones lead us on a wild goose chase!

Beautiful ornate building!. The Madrasa was a beautiful building, full of wonderful carvings and a maze of little rooms. It is very cheap to get in (only 10 dirhams) but doesn't offer much more than just wandering around the lovely buildings. Top tip: go upstairs and see the views of the main square from above! A must-see in Marrakech.

One of the most interesting buildings in Marrakech. Easy to pop into on your walk through the medina and definitely worth doing. Also a cool refuge on a hot summers day. No information provided so a guide might be useful although perfectly possible to enjoy just looking round.

Right in the middle of the action in Marrakesh - definitely worth a visit. It is a relief to get out of the Souks into a beautifully decorated Madrasa. Cheap entrance, and not much information to be had, but you can explore the rooms unhindered. Definitely worth a visit.

Gorgeous architecture, great for photo ops!. Our hired guide for the morning led us from our Riad to this beautiful school. Very interested to learn about how the students lived & spent their days here. The architecture is just beautiful, my favorite place in Marrakech. Great opportunities upstairs to take interesting photos from opposing windows.

Gorgeous architecture and design. Ben Youssef Madrasa was on our route to the souks from our Riad, so we had to go in and look! We paid a small amount to get in but it was worth it. Very interesting! Some wonderful photo opportunities in the courtyard. Definitely some where that should be on your 'to visit' list whilst in Marrakech!
Amazing carved plasterwork. We really liked it just for the beautiful carved plasterwork, the tiles and woodwork. It is an empty building, but the architectural details make it well worth a visit.
cool place. It is too touristic and not so expensive. I did not like it so much but is a must see in Marrakech. Around this you have other nice places.
The most beautiful place we visited in Marrakech. Definitely worth finding. Stunningly detailed architecture and lots of nooks and crannies to explore.
Worth the trip. Highly recommended. If you go to Marrakech, this is one of the places you should see. Beautiful and makes you ponder about the people who lived and ruled.

A piece of history. We visited here with a local guide and he was able to tell us a lot of things about the place you wouldn't otherwise know. As a museum of sorts there is no information around to guide the informed tourist. Nonetheless it is still a brilliant place to stroll around and imagine being a student at the elite university of old Marrakech. We were charged 10dh each.
Lovely place. Enjoyed our visit. It is a must do if in Marrakech. Very close to riad we stayed in a 5 minutes walk away. Spent a few hours here at at nearby places.

Beautiful and well worth the trip. We visited the madrasa one morning as we toured the medina. The madrasa is outstanding and had many incredible areas to point out. Make sure the see the courtyard, the prayer area and the rooms upstairs. We were told that the rooms with windows facing the inside the courtyard were for the more advanced scholars. The rooms facing the street or with no window, were for the less capable. Tip: I took the best pictures of the courtyard from the rooms above. Leave about 30 minutes for this visit.

Beautiful. Beautiful architecture and perfect for photographers.Reasonable entry fee.We didn't have a tour guide, but I think there are tours available (and they don't harass nor pressure you into paying for one, which is good for Marrakech).4 stars given because if there were any placards with information, it would be perfect and more appealing to know the place's history.

Wonderful madrasa, but all are pretty similar. In the average madrasa, there is little to see. The tilework is interesting, and certainly these represent a place of reprieve from the bustle of the surrounding souk, but there is nothing to see here except the structure itself, and even that is limited in that it is purely an interior space. I suspect that this ancient school would mean more to someone of the Muslim faith.
Beautiful. If you can research some of its history before you go, exploring will be more meaningful. Beautiful tile and wood work.

Beautiful - go in the afternoon if you're a photographer. One of the highlights of our trip - entry is 10Dh. And while it's smaller than the medersas we visited in other parts of Morocco, it was still gorgeous - especially the beautiful calligraphy and wooden window panels. Also nice and cool refuge from the heat.
Beautiful place. Very beautiful architecture but not much else to see or learn unless you pay for a guide. Don't forget to go upstairs and take photos

Very Interesting. Visited in June 2015, paid just 10dr each for entry I believe but our best move was paying an extra 50dr to one of the guides available at the Madrassa - we got a very informative private tour which made the visit for us and brought the whole place to life.

Interesting place, beautiful carvings. Not the best start to this visit with the taxi dropping us off with his mate who proceeded to 'guide' us there and divert us to the tannery, and then insist we pay him 200 dirhams for the privilege (which we didn't - but he wasn't happy). The 10dirhams entry is a bargain. There's no info throughout but the building itself is really interesting to explore, and the carvings are beautiful!

Back in the day. This was the Harvard of Marrakesh in its day. Now the architecture dazzles, but the rooms look small and cramped. That is how people lived, and still do for the most part. I taught at the successor of this school - Thanawiyat Medrasa Ben Youssef. Peace Corps. English. The school was housed in a former barracks for Senegalese troops to keep order for the French. Called "Dar al Barood", or house of guns. The French, and the Senegalese, were sent off in 1956, during independence. Thanawiyat Ben Youissef was taken over by the Istaqlal (Independence) Party of Morocco, to uplift Moroccan youth. Long story short, nice kids, no money for books or electricity (Peace Corps - who cares), great experience. The present school is a decent museum of the past. Some of my colleagues at Dar al Barood actually taught at the old school. I love being part of its history.

Worth 10 Dirrham for 30 minutes. This is better than the Bahia Palace. Nice to see how the students live several hundred years ago. As in most Morrocan monuments, it's relative well preserve. There is no plaque to explain how the students live. Read on-line before hand if you do not have a guide. Visit took no more than 30 minutes.
Go early.. Go early in the morning before tour groups and you will have the unobstructed photographs. The stairs have no railings so extra caution.

A CALM RETREAT. The lower floor of the Medersa was beautiful but was very interesting to go upstairs and view the rooms in which students would have lived and studied. Small, sparse and plain. Good to see.

One of the better buildings. Compared to a few other of the sights to see this is one of the better ones, more to see and do and more to explore, very busy at around midday so maybe better to explore early morning or late afternoon. Be aware that this area the locals are more aggressive and will try to send you to the tanneries!!!! Nothing really to worry about but the attitude does change in this area...
Interesting. Visited here on a day trip around, beautiful architecture and some nice photo opportunities through the first floor windows

Interesting. At the start of the souk in the medina, sits Ben Yousssef Madrasa. This historic college gives you a chance to see very old dorm rooms and classic Moroccan architecture. Worth a quick visit.
Interesting and beautiful. Interesting to learn about the history of the place but also stunning to walk around. Was great as part of a 3hr tour of the city

Amazing visit. This is the only mosque which non-Moslems can visit in Marrakech, and is really worth seeing. It is beautiful inside, but also it is fascinating to see an unspoilt and genuine madrasa, which happens to have the finest architecture in Marrakech.
Stunning architecture. Amazing architecture, a maze of little hidden rooms, easy to spend one or two hours in the calm and serenity of Ben Youssef.
Beautiful. A must see- really serene and fascinating. Stunning architecture and plenty of opportunity to take tours around.
worth a visit. great architecture and ambiance. very quiet on the day we visited which was magical. Make sure you do the first floor for views down in to the courtyards - great photo ops
Enjoyed my visit. well worth the visit. Situated an easy walk from the central plaza of Jamaa El Fna, this school has interesting architecture

Great insight into the fascinating culture of this country. Great history ! Well worth a visit. The architecture was wonderful and has been well pereserved. Some of the information can be a little difficult to read. A tip would be to get a guide who will take your around a number of these sites. Visit in a morning before it gets to hot..

Interesting, better with a guide. Fascinating history and amazing architecture,
I think a good educated guide would make this a better experience
glimpses of spiritual school. One of the highlights in my Marrakech trip. Beautiful architecture and it is interesting to see and explore the classrooms of the students.

Largest Madrasa in Morocco. It is a beautiful feat of architecture, with beautiful Islamic wall carvings and tile and woodwork it's a very peaceful and educational trip. We had also gone through the Madrasa Abou Einania in Meknes and studied the architecture and history for our class, so we wandered through this one without a guide.
Amazing place. A beautiful trasure inside the city, with a lot of culture, colours and stories to tell. It's an amazing program if it's too warm outside, as well
Peaceful afen. I truly enjoyed the atmosphere and beauty of this place. It was an amazing building with exotic decorations which gave such a feeling of peace and spirituality
Beautiful. Very atmospheric,, authentically restored, good value for money, 10 dirhams entry fee. Close to Musee Marrakech.
AMAZING!. Make sure you have a guide that will explain the remarkable history of the Koranic school...Magnificently ornate.
well wlrth the visit. A must see when in Marrakesh. Very interesting building a photographer's dream. Take your time to explore the narrow streets as you walk there.

Beautiful Moorish Architecture!. Ben Youssef Madrasa is a beautiful example of Moorish architecture. Walking through and imagining the lives of the students transported us to a different time and culture. The building was cool and shady on a hot summer day.

A masterpiece. This beautifully carved and exquisitely designed facility is definitely worth visiting, but I do recommend you bring a guide unless you truly only want to drink in the splendor and get some stunning photos. It is a lovely place that you would never guess is there from the outside. The carving is among the best in Marrakesh and well preserved, so I strongly recommend this spot even for the most casual tourist.
Great panoramic views. Our guide Mohammad was very knowledgable and this World UNESCO site is well worth the visit! Home to films such as Cleopatra, Lawrence of Arabia and Gladiator.

lovely details and architecture. This is definitely worth a visit, as the building is lovely and the architectural details and workmanship are incredible. It was quiet and inexpensive to enter. The negatives are that the washroom wasn't very clean or well marked - functional but bring your own soap and toilet paper. Also I think that if you want any actual information about the place you need a guide or do a little research. It is still extremely enjoyable to step inside and enjoy the beauty.

Peaceful and enigmatic. This place was around the corner 5 mins from the guesthouse I was staying at, a cool chill-out place with great staff call dar nour el houda I cover in another review.This place was a great way to spend an hour or two with another hour at the museum next door. Took lots of photos of the tiles and plasterwork. Amazing colours and glazes.Don't miss this place when visiting Marrakech. Entry price low with the other museum included.
Wonderful Architecture. Very thought provoking and wonderful architecture, well worth a visit. Pick your times though it can be very busy

Fun place to explore for older kids. This medersa closes at 4:45 or 5pm so come early or you will miss it like we did the first time. Unlike the medersas we saw in Fes, this one is huge with several student living quarters organized in sections or wings on the upper storeys. The workmanship is gorgeous and you can take pictures of each other across the courtyard, peeping out of the little windows. Kids would probably enjoy exploring "hidden" stairs and rooms that lead from lower rooms.Outside the Ben Youssef medersa by its signage is an unfinished (maybe modern) or broken geometric star like the kind you see in interconnected, geometric star cedar carvings on medersa doors. This one was traced in plaster if I remember right. Gives you clues on how such stars were made by shifting a square at a consistent angle.

Centre of calm in the chaos of The Souk.. Cut off from the outside world for study and contemplation, The Madrasa is an elegant and restrained building. Like so much Moroccan architecture, the outside is plain and the inside a surprise. We worth a visit. Hard to imagine how 900 students fitted into the 130 cells.
Amazing.. Beautiful building with great architecture. Would recommend a visit when going to the souks as the building is located at the north end of the souks.

Stunning. Whether you are Islamic or not, this place should be on the hotlist to visit. The stunning architecture and the coolness with in the building are a must see. There are some steep steps to get up to the upper levels which meant for me (mobility issues) that we could not go up however even if that is a factor for yourselves go.
Amazing!. Historically rich and with an outstanding architecture. I found it was not expensive at all. Put this in your must do list when you are in Marrakesh.

Fascinating piece of history. One of the many fascinating places that our guide took us during our day in Marrakech. The largest madrasa in Morocco, it is interesting for both its history and the beautiful decor with stunning carvings of cedar, marble and stucco.

Stunning Moroccan architecture. The Ben Youssef Madrasa simply amaze you, if it is your first encounter with Moroccan architecture. It is beautiful, peaceful, with a cool & calm atmosphere, and wonderful place to visit, and at only 10dh super value too.
Gorgeous. Absolutely gorgeous - we had a guide who took us here and it's such an amazing example of local architecture. We didn't spend long here, but we are very happy that we stopped to see it!

boring. I guess this is an attraction that one is expected to visit so we did. Boring boring boring. I love history but this is not a particularly attractive building and is derelict, so nothing of interest to see whatsoever. Don't bother!

Can't beat the price!. Sadly I can't review any of the palaces and Madras of Marrakech too highly as they are all in a bit of a state of disarray. . If you haven't visited anything similar before here or in Spain, take a look for your own general education and I will say for the price it is definitely worth a look. There is not a whole lot to see but there are some beautiful tiles and archways. I would loved to have had a little more access to information about this site while I was touring it as there is not much in terms of signs and explanations.

Beautiful architecture and little rooms to explore. As you can see from the reviews its a must see in Marrakech for a little cultural trip and look at old traditional Morrocan architecture. It cost 50 MAD to get in, not too bad, slightly more expensive than other places to see, like the palaces in Marrakech. I would recommend paying for a guide if you can so that the visit means something, but be aware their english may not be great, they do try to accommodate though, and do feel like you need to pay over the odds for a 10 minute tour!

Amazing architect. Planning to return to this site and further absorb the atmosphere of this Madrasa. It is within the wall and gates of the ancient city of Marrakesh in the Medina. The amazing deco from recent renovations, though modern, but retained its old and original qualities. Worth visiting by all means. Visitors are allowed entrance and for the better part of the visit, no harassment. So feel free to ask questions and take as many photos as possible.

Well presented But Get a Guide. i think this is the sort of place where you really need a tour guide who speaks your language to get the full enjoyment, if your a solo traveler on a budget then turn up and tag on to a tour and give the guide a few dirhams after :)
Great tiles . At only D10 to enter this is worth a quick visit to see the beautiful tiles and take some great photos. Quiet and tranquil even with crowds of tourists.

Impressive building with outstanding architecture. This madrasa in the heart of the medina was one of our highlights. It was a nice walk from the main square and there will friendly people along the way both going and coming that helped us find our bearings.

Just stunning, a must visit. Of all the places we visited while in Marrakech this was my favourite. We arrived about 9.30am and were there for a good hour or so, by which time it was starting to get busy with tour groups so do go early for a quiet visit and the best photography opportunities.Something to also note is that the 3-in-1 that has been mentioned in some past reviews is no longer available. It was only 10dh to get in and a further 50dh for the museum next door though so still VERY cheap. It was also easy to find, simply by following the Souks at Jemaa el Fna all the way through from the bottom to the top, and it's sign-posted from there.The place is absolutely beautiful and the maze of rooms within the building provide some relief from the heat. There are also toilets which is a plus! We didn't have a guide as we explored the city ourselves from the basis of our riad, but the guidebook we had (a DK Top 10) had a lot of information so this gave us a good background to the building, its origin and history. I could've spent all day here.

Must see when in Marrakech. Extraordinary buildings that have so many stories to tell. Unless you take a guide or a guidebook you'll miss most of what this sight meant. Try and arrive first thing to appreciate the atmosphere before it becomes too crowded and noisy.
Worth a visit if in area. This is worth a visit to see the beautifully decoration with traditional tiles. The rooms have open windows into court yard for a good photo opportunity.

Sacred School. Very interesting place, located at the old market in Marrakech, where you will see and experience bicycle, motorcycle, mule, locals and tourists in one tiny street..The local says, Ben Youssef Madrasa is one of the oldest Koran school in North Afrika..the place is so peaceful, sacred and you can imgaine how the students learn the Koran by touching the beautiful mosaic walls and columns...beautiful place..
Must see. Nicely restored Madrassa in some parts which breathtaking photo opportunities. Definitely a must see, make sure you get there before the crowds as it can be a very peaceful place

Well worth a visit. Like most properties in Marrakech this is in need of further renovation. Nevertheless an interesting place to visit. The museum of Marrakech and the photographic museum are nearby and the combined tour will make an interesting half day.

Authentic architecture, very picturesque. This wander-through gives you a real taste of this historic, Islamic school; it's a beautiful building with many places to wander in and to take pictures in. This madersa is much like the one in Fes, but a little bigger and highly detailed.
Recommend!. Its a nice place, a school from XI or XII centuries, nice building, different and well preserved architecture! Nice, but there could be more explanation of the history of the place.

The most wonderful piece of art in Marrakech.. We were shocked by the beauty of this magnificent building, a true feast for the eyes. Everything so beautufully detailed and executed, the airy , imposing courtyard command impressive views. A must-do for sure.

Interesting historical site. Our guide took us there and his explanations made it all the more interesting for us. I think without a guide you would not appreciate it fully. The architecture, mosaics and intricate carvings are a fine example of what you would expect to find in Marrakech.

Definitely worth a look. Located in a wonderful old building which doesn't look much from the outside, once inside it expands like the TARDIS. There are lots of rooms to have a wander through and loads of great architectural details to look at and photograph! Entry price was cheap too; definitely worth a couple of hours of your time!

Amazing find. It took a while to find this but what a gem of architecture and amazing mosaic and floor designs.It is definitely worth the trouble to find it,as it is a marvel to see amongst all the soukes
Interesting. an old mosque that was interesting to see for 30 minutes or so. Was brought there with a guide on a tour of the city. Interesting to see

What a surprise!. The description of this as a former school or college does not do it justice. The architecture and carvings are amazing. Great sense of history. Combine the tour with a visit to the museum next door and it is good value for money.

ben youssef. Lovely. Best example of alhambra architecture still intact. Cool. Peaceful. Avoid crowds toward the end of the day though. Really nice and clean little cafe just across from the entrance.

Just like the pictures.. Amazing building full of wonderful carvings and mosaics. However that is it. What you see in the pictures is all there is. The pool was empty when we went. There are no snippets of info about anything unless you pay a dodgy guide. The whole place is empty and starting to crumble. Little evidence of efforts to look after it. We were around it and out in 20 minutes tops.

Historic Site. Awesome building with beautiful workmanship. Would recommend to go early as when we were there mid- morning the narrow hallways were crowded..but still able to appreciate all that was offer
A step back in time. The architecture and craftsmanship that went into this building centuries ago is amazing. If you are in Marrakech, this is a must see. Arrange for a tour guide to learn more.

Great example of life in a Koran school and of Moorish Architecture. It was really great to see where people lived during the last 600 years while they studied the Koran. It has a great classic Moorish architecture and design.
Stunning. This is an amazing place to explore. It must have been magnificent in its day as its stunning. Difficult to find but well worth the effort.

Not that great . The main courtyard and the designs on the building are lovely, par this I do not see the appeal. There are no signs or explanations as to what exactly the history is of the site. Without knowing in advance or paying for a guide you see a lovely courtyard and a lot of rooms for students that are empty. There is nothing further to see and it amazes me how anyone could spend hours here, 30 mins to hour top with no history lesson!

It's cheap, but that's it. It's only 10dh to get in so it is cheap. There is one main room that does have some beautiful carvings in, the rest is very small rooms were students use to live. All the rooms look pretty much the same. There are no signs or explanations of anything so maybe it would be better with a guide. Personally I found it a bit boring and don't understand how so many others have loved it.

Visit to Marrakech highlights. Ben Youssef is well worth a visit. Can take a bit of finding but just ask a local, they are the most helpful of people.The plaster work on the walls and arches is really splendid. There is not a great deal of information on site so take your good guide book.Gets busy with tours after about 10.30am so for a good look go early. Admittance fee very small.
great.... it was my first visit in marrakesh, it has an important role in the history of the city... it is recommendable to visit... pretty close to the shouk and the musée

A gem. We were with a group but went here in our free time and were very glad we did. The idea of all those theology students living in those little cells was very evocative and the building itself was beautiful. Well worth a visit.

An under-advertised gem. This was well down the list of places we wanted to visit in Marrakech but turned out to be one of the highlights. Amazing, architecture, carvings and tiling- we took more photos here than anywhere else on the trip!
